src: Pastikan tangan anda setenang yang boleh sementara masih menekan semua tanda dengan betul - selain itu, cuba untuk tidak membuat gerakan luaran dengan jari anda. Dengan cara ini, anda akan memenatkan diri sendiri sesedikit yang mungkin. Ingatlah bahawa tidak perlu menggunakan banyak tenaga untuk menekan kekunci untuk mendapat bunyi yang kuat seperti piano. Pada akordion, bagi mendapatkan kelantangan tambahan, anda guna pakai belos pada tekanan atau kelajuan yang lebih tinggi.
mt: Make sure your hands are as relaxed as possible while still pressing all the keys correctly - otherwise, try not to make any unnecessary movements with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember that you don't need to use a lot of force to press the keys to get a loud sound like a piano. On the accordion, to get more volume, you use bellows at a higher pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Salah satu masalah yang sering berlaku ialah apabila percubaan menukar filem ke format DVD adalah overscan. Kebanyakan televisyen dibuat dengan satu cara untuk memudahkan orang awam. Oleh sebab itu, semua yang anda dapat lihat di TV telah dipotong bingkainya, atas, bawah dan tepi. Ini adalah untuk memastikan imej berkenaan meliputi seluruh skrin. Ini digelar “overscan” Malangnya, bila anda membuat DVD, bahagian tepinya barangkali akan dipotong juga, dan jika video mempunyai sari kata terlalu dekat pada bahagian bawah, mereka tidak akan sepenuhnya dipaparkan.
mt: One of the most common problems is when trying to convert film to DVD is overscan. Most televisions are made one way to make it easy for the general public. Therefore, everything you can see on TV has had its borders cut off, top, bottom and sides. This is to ensure that the image in question covers the entire screen. This is called “overscan” Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, the edges may be cut off as well, and if the video has subtitles too close to the bottom, they will not be fully displayed.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Rancangan Amerika bergantung kepada pelancaran serangan koordinasi dari tiga arah yang berbeza. Jeneral John Cadwalder akan melancarkan serangan pengalihan perhatian melawan garison British di Bordentown, untuk menyekat bala bantuan. Jeneral James Ewing akan membawa 700 milisi merentasi sungai di Feri Trenton, rampas jambatan di anak sungai Assunpink dan menghalang sebarang pasukan musuh daripada melarikan diri. Kuasa serangan utama seramai 2,400 askar akan menyeberangi sungai yang terletak 9 batu di utara Trenton, dan kemudian dibahagikan kepada dua kumpulan, di bawah kepimpinan Greene dan Sullivan masing-masing, untuk melancarkan serangan sebelum subuh.
mt: The American plan depended on a coordinated attack from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, to block reinforcements. General James Ewing would lead 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge at the Assunpink Creek and block any enemy retreat. The main attack force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then be divided into two groups, under Greene and Sullivan respectively, to launch the attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Setelah diterim pakai oleh kongres pada 4hb JUlai, draf bertulis yang ditandatangani Presiden kongres John Hancock dan Setiausaha Charles Thomson telah dihantar ke kedai pencetakan John Dunlap yang terletak beberapa blok jauhnya. Sepanjang malam di antara 150 hingga 200 salinan telah dibuat, kini dikenali sebagai “Dunlap broadsides”. Pembacaan pertama dokumen ini kepada orang awam adalah oleh John Nixon di halaman Dewan Kemerdekaan pada 8 Julai. Satu dihantar ke George Washinton pada 6hb Julai, yang telah dibacakan kepada pasukannya di New York pada 9hb Julai. Sesalinan sampai di London pada 10hb Ogos. 25 cetakan buku sisi lebar Dunlap diketahui masih wujud ialah salinan dokumen tertua yang masih ada. Salinan tulisan tangan yang asal sudah tiada.
mt: After being accepted by Congress on July 4, the written draft signed by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson was sent to the printing shop of John Dunlap, located a few blocks away. Throughout the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides". The first reading of the document to the public was by John Nixon on the Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, which was read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy arrived in London on August 10. 25 Dunlap broadsides are known to still exist, the oldest surviving copy of the document. The original handwritten copy no longer exists.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Pihak Kolonis, selepas menyaksikan aktiviti ini, juga memanggil tenaga bantuan. Pasukan askar yang memperkukuh barisan depan termasuk regimen pertama dan ketiga New Hampshire yang mengandungi 200 anggota, di bawah Kolonel John Stark dan Kolonel James Reed (mereka berdua kemudian menjadi jeneral). Askar Stark mengambil kedudukan di sepanjang pagar di bahagian utara kedudukan pihak Kolonis. Apabila air surut telah membuka sebuah celah sepanjang Sungai Mystic sepanjang timur laut semenanjung tersebut, mereka telah dengan cepat memanjangkan pagar dengan dinding batu yang pendek mengarah ke utara dan berakhir di tepi air di sebuah pantai kecil. Gridley atau Stark meletakkan pancang sekitar 100 kaki (30 m) di hadapan pagar dan memerintah tidak seorang melepaskan tembakan sehingga pelalu tetap lalu.
mt: The British, after observing this activity, also called for reinforcements.  The army's front line included the first and third regiments of New Hampshire, containing 200 men, under Colonel John Stark and Colonel James Reed (both later became generals).  Stark's men took position along the fence on the north side of the British position.  When the tide receded, it had opened a gap along the northeast shore of the peninsula, and they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall facing north and ending at the water's edge on a small beach.  Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered no one to fire until the enemy had passed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Cina purba telah mempunyai cara unik untuk menunjukkan tempoh masa yang berbeza-beza, setiap peringkat dari Cina atau setiap keluarga yang berkuasa pada waktu tersebut mempunyai dinasti tersendirinya. Antara setiap dinasti juga terdapat zaman wilayah yang tidak stabil dan berpecah belah. Paling terkenal pada zaman ini ialah zaman Tiga Kerajaan yang berlaku selama 60 tahun antara Dinasti Han dan Jin. Dalam jangka waktu tersebut peperangan sengit telah tercetus antara beberapa bangsawan yang merebutkan takhta. Three Kingdoms adalah satu era pertumpahan darah dalam sejarah Ancient China beribu orang mati bergaduh untuk duduk atas kerusi tertinggi dalam istana besar di Xi’an.
mt: The ancient Chinese had a unique way of showing different periods of time, each level of China or each ruling family had its own dynasty. Between each dynasty there was also a period of unstable and fragmented regions. Most famous during this time was the era of the Three Kingdoms which lasted for 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During this time there was a fierce war between several nobles who fought for the throne. Three Kingdoms was an era of bloodshed in the history of Ancient China thousands of people died fighting for the top seat in the big palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Koloni tentera semut berarak dan juga bersarang dalam fasa yang berbeza. Dalam fasa nomad, semut tentera bergerak pada waktu malam dan berhenti berehat di siang hari. Koloni itu memulakan fasa nomad apabila makanan sediada berkurangan. Semasa fasa ini,koloni ituy membuat sarang sementara yang ditukar setiap hari. Setiap episod amukan atau perarakan nomad ini berlangsung selama kira-kira 17 hari.
mt: Ant colonies march and also nest in different phases. In the nomad phase, soldier ants move at night and stop resting during the day. The colony begins the nomad phase when food is running low. During this phase, the colony makes a temporary nest that is changed every day. Each episode of the rampage or nomad march lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Banyak ritma yang diperhatikan dalam fisiologi dan tingkah laku biasanya sangat bergantung kepada kewujudan kitaran endogen dan penghasilannya melalui jam biologi. Rentak berkala, yang bukan sekadar respons kepada isyarat eksternal berkala, telah didokumentasi untuk kebanyakan makhluk hidup, termasuk bakteria, kulat, tumbuh-tumbuhan dan haiwan. Jam biologi adalah pengayun mandiri yang akan meneruskan jangkamasa kitaran bebas walaupun tanpa isyarat luaran.
mt: Many rhythms observed in physiology and behavior are often very dependent on the existence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Rhythmicity, which is not just a response to external periodic signals, has been documented for most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that will continue the cycle period free of external signals.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Sebuah populasi merupakan sekumpulan organisma dari spesies yang tertentu dalam sebuah kawasan geografik yang ditentukan. Apabila semua individu dalam populasi adalah sama dengan mengambil kira sifat fenotip tertentu, mereka dikenali sebagai monomorfik. Apabila individu menunjukkan beberapa variasi daripada perangai khusus mereka adalah polimorfik.
mt: A population is a group of organisms of the same species living in the same geographical area. If all individuals in a population are the same with regard to a particular phenotype, they are known as monomorphic. If individuals show some variation from the usual behavior, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Sebuah populasi merupakan sekumpulan organisma dari spesies yang tertentu dalam sebuah kawasan geografik yang ditentukan. mt: A population is a group of organisms of the same species living in the same geographical area. If all individuals in a population are the same with regard to a particular phenotype, they are known as monomorphic. If individuals show some variation from the usual behavior, they are polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Pelancongan berasaskan alam semula jadi menarik minat orang untuk mengunjungi kawasan semula jadi dengan tujuan menikmati pemandangan, termasuk tumbuhan dan hidupan liar. Contoh aktiviti-aktiviti yang boleh dilakukan termasuk memburu, memancing, fotografi, memerhati burung, dan mengunjungi taman serta mempelajari maklumat mengenai ekosistem. Contohnya adalah melawat, mengambil gambar, dan belajar tentang organgatuang di Borneo.
mt: Nature-based tourism attracts people to visit natural areas for the purpose of enjoying scenery, including plants and wildlife. Examples of activities that can be done include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and learning about ecosystems. For example, visiting, taking pictures, and learning about orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Setiap pagi, orang meninggal bandar-bandar kecil dalam kereta untuk ke tempat kerja dan dilepasi oleh orang lain yang mana destinasi tempat kerja ialah tempat yang mereka baharu tinggalkan. Dalam pengangkutan ulang-alik yang dinamik ini semua orang, dengan apa cara pun, ada kaitannya dan menyokong sistem pengangkutan berdasarkan kereta persendirian. Sains kini menunjukkan bahwa ekonomi karbon yang besar telah melepaskan biosfera daripada satu daripada negerinya yang stabil dan telah pernah menyokong evolusi manusia untukl dua juta tahun yang lalu.
mt: Every morning, people die in small towns in cars on the way to work and passed by others whose destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic shuttle transportation system everyone, in any way, has a connection and supports a car-based transportation system. Science now shows that the big carbon economy has released the biosphere from one of its stable states and has once supported human evolution for two million years ago.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atom boleh dianggap sebagai salah satu blok binaan asas bagi semua jirim. Ianya sebuah entiti yang sangat kompleks terdiri daripada satu model Bohr yang dipermudahkan, pusat nukleus pusat diorbitkan oleh elektron, sama dengan planet-planet yang mengorbit matahari - lihat Rajah 1.1. Nukleus terdiri daripada dua partikel iaitu neutron dan proton. Proton ada caj elektrik positif manakala neutron tiada mempunyai caj. Elektron ada caj elektrik negatif.
mt: An atom can be considered one of the basic building blocks of all matter. It is a very complex entity consisting of a simplified Bohr model, a nucleus at the center orbited by electrons, much like planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles, neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Hampir semua komputer yang digunakan hari ini adalah berdasarkan kepada manipulasi maklumat yang dikodkan dalam bentuk nombor perduaan. Nombor binari hanya dapat mengandungi satu dari dua nilai, iaitu 0 atau 1, dan nombor-nombor tersebut dikenali sebagai angka binari, atau bit, dalam istilah komputer.
mt: Almost all computers used today are based on manipulating information encoded in the form of binary numbers. Binary numbers can only contain one of two values, 0 or 1, and these numbers are known as bits in computer terminology.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Hampir semua komputer yang digunakan hari ini adalah berdasarkan kepada manipulasi maklumat yang dikodkan dalam bentuk nombor perduaan. Nombor binari hanya dapat mengandungi satu dari dua nilai, iaitu 0 atau 1, dan nombor-nombor tersebut dikenali sebagai angka binari, atau bit, dalam istilah komputer.
mt: Almost all computers used today are based on manipulating information encoded in the form of binary numbers. Binary numbers can only contain one of two values, 0 or 1, and these numbers are known as bits in computer terminology.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Blog juga dapat membantu meningkatkan penulisan pelajar. Walaupun pelajar sering memulakan pengalaman blog mereka dengan kesalahan tatabahasa dan ejaan, kehadiran penonton secara amnya dapat mengubahnya. Oleh kerana pelajar sering merupakan audiens yang paling kritikal, penulis blog itu mula berusaha memperbaiki penulisan untuk mengelakkan kritikan. Menulis blog juga “memaksa pelajar untuk lebih menyedari dunia di sekeliling mereka.” Keperluan untuk menarik minat pembaca memberi inspirasi kepada pelajar untuk menulis dengan bijak dan menarik (Toto, 2004). Menulis blog ialah alatan yang memberi inspirasi kepada kerjasama, dan menggalakkan pelajar untuk memperluas pembelajaran melebihi hari sekolah tradisional. Penggunaan blog yang sesuai “dapat memberi peluang kepada pelajar untuk menjadi lebih analitik dan kritikal; melalui tindak balas kepada bahan internet secara aktif, pelajar boleh menentukan kedudukan mereka dalam konteks penulisan orang lain dan juga menggariskan perspektif mereka sendiri dengan isu-isu berkaitan (Oravec. 2002)
mt: Blogs can also help improve student writing. Although students often begin their blogging experience with grammatical and spelling errors, the presence of an audience in general can change this. Because students are often the most critical audience, bloggers begin to try to improve their writing to avoid criticism. Writing blogs also “forces students to be more aware of the world around them.” The need to attract readers gives inspiration to students to write wisely and attractively (Toto, 2004). Appropriate use of blogs “can provide opportunities for students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can determine their position in the context of others' writing and also outline their own perspectives on related issues (Oravec. 2002)
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Komunikasi tak segerak menggalakkan waktu untuk renungan dan tindak balas terhadap orang lain. Ia membolehkan pelajar untuk belajar mengikut keupayaan mereka sendiri dan mengawal kadar maklumat pengajaran. Sebagai tambahan, terdapat pengurangan kekangan waktu dengan kemungkinan waktu bekerja yang fleksibel. (Bremer, 1998) Penggunaan Internet dan Jaringan Sejagat membolehkan pelajar memiliki akses kepada maklumat pada bila-bila masa. Pelajar juga boleh mengemukakan soalan kepada pengajar pada bila-bila masa sepanjang hari dan menjangkakan jawapan yang pantas, berbanding menunggu sehingga pertemuan bersemuka yang berikutnya.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows for reflection and response time to others. It allows students to learn at their own pace and control the rate of information instruction. In addition, there is a reduction in time constraints with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows students to have access to information at any time. Students can also pose questions to instructors at any time throughout the day and expect quick responses, as opposed to waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Kastil zaman pertengahan tradisional telah lama menjadi inspirasi daya imaginasi yang membawa ingatan sukan lawan tombak, jamuan dan kesatriaan zaman Arthur. Walaupun berdiri di tengah-tengah runtuhan yang berusia ribuan tahun ianya mudah untuk membawa bunyi dan bau daripada pertempuran lama yang berlalu, hingga hampir mendengar kuku kelentang pada batu kerikil dan bau ketakutan yang semakin meningkat pada lubang-lubang penjara. Namun adakah imaginasi kita berdasarkan realiti? Mengapa istana dibina pada asalnya? Bagaimanakah ia direka dan dibina?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long been an inspiration of the imagination that brings to mind the sport of jousting, feasting and chivalry of the Arthurian era. Although standing in the midst of ruins that are thousands of years old it is easy to bring the sounds and smells of the long past battles, almost hearing the clink of mail on pebbles and the increasing fear of the dungeon. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Biasanya bagi tempoh tersebut, Istana Kirby Muxloe adalah lebih daripada sebuah rumah yang berkubu dari istana sebenar. Tingkap-tingkap kaca besar dan dinding nipisnya tidak akan mampu untuk menentang serangan hebat untuk tempoh yang lama. Pada 1480-an, ketika pembinaannya baharu dimulakan oleh Lord Hastings, negara tersebut masih aman dan pertahanannya hanya diperlukan untuk melawan kumpulan kecil perompak.
mt: Normally for that period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more than a house with a castle from the real castle. Large glass windows and thin walls would not be able to withstand a heavy attack for a long time. In the 1480s, when its construction was newly started by Lord Hastings, the country was still safe and its defense was only needed to fight small groups of pirates.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Dengan perubahan daripada larian suku batu ke larian setengah batu, kelajuan menjadi kurang penting dan daya tahan menjadi keperluan mutlak. Sudah tentu pelari jarak setengah batu kelas pertama, seorang yang mampu kurang dari dua minit, memiliki kelajuan yang agak tinggi, namun daya tahan mesti dipupuk dalam semua keadaan yang bahaya. Merentas desa ketika musim sejuk, digabungkan dengan senaman gimnasium untuk bahagian atas badan adalah persediaan terbaik untuk musim larian.
mt: With the change from quarter-mile to half-mile races, speed becomes less important and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course, the first-class half-mile runner, a man who can run less than two minutes, has a fairly high speed, but endurance must be developed in all kinds of dangerous weather. Crossing the village in winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body is the best preparation for the racing season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Amalan pemakanan yang betul sahaja tidak dapat menjaminkan prestasi elit, tetapi ia boleh mempengaruhi kesejahteraan atlet muda secara keseluruhan. Mengekalkan keseimbangan tenaga yang sihat, mengamalkan tabiat minum air yang efektif dan memahami pelbagai aspek daripada amalan makanan tambahan dapat membantu atlet memperbaiki persembahan dan meningkatkan minat mereka dalam sukan yang diceburi.
mt: Good nutrition practices alone cannot guarantee elite performance, but it can influence the overall well-being of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits and understanding various aspects of dietary supplementation can help athletes improve their performance and increase their interest in the sport they pursue.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Larian jarak sederhana ialah sukan yang agak murah; namun, terdapat banyak tanggapan salah mengenai sebilangan kecil peralatan yang diperlukan untuk mengambil bahagian. Produk boleh dibeli jika perlu, tetapi kebanyakan akan ada kesan yang kecil atau tidak ada kesan sama sekali ke atas prestasi. Atlet mungkin merasa bahawa mereka lebih suka sesuatu produk walaupun ia tidak memberikan manfaat sebenar.
mt: A short-distance race is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are a number of misconceptions about a small number of equipment needed to participate. Products can be purchased if necessary, but most will have little or no effect on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer something product even though it does not provide the real benefit.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: MRI adalah berdasarkan fenomena fizik yang dipanggil resonans magnetik nuklear (NMR), yang telah ditemui pada 1930-an oleh Felix Bloch (bekerja di Universiti Stanford) dan Edward Purcell (dari Universiti Harvard). Dalam resonans ini, medan magnet dan gelombang radio menyebabkan atom mengeluarkan isyarat-isyarat radio yang kecil. Pada tahun 1970, Raymond Damadian, seorang doktor perubatan dan saintis kajian telah menemukan asas penggunaan pengimejan resonans magnet sebagai alat untuk diagnosis perubatan. Selepas empat tahun paten diluluskan, yang merupakan paten pertama dunia dalam bidang MRI. Dalam 1977, Dr. Damadian menyelesaikan pembinaan scanner MRI seluruh badan yang pertama, yang digelar oleh beliau sebagai “Indomitable”.
mt: MRI is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, a magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and scientist, discovered the basis for using NMR imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. After four years of patenting, which was the first patent in the world in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first whole-body MRI scanner, which he called the "Indomitable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Manusia merupakan spesies yang paling berbakat dalam membaca fikiran orang lain. Ini bermaksud kita dapat meramalkan apa yang dirasai, dihasrat, dipercaya, diketahui atau diinginkan oleh manusia lain. Di antara kebolehan ini, kefahaman terhadap hasrat orang lain adalah amat penting. Ia membenarkan kita menyelesaikan ketaksaan tindakan fizikal. Sebagai contoh, jika anda melihat seseorang memecahkan tingkap kereta, anda akan berpendapat bahawa dia sedang cuba mencuri kereta orang yang tidak dikenali. Dia akan perlu dinilai berbeza-beza jika dia telah kehilangan kunci keretanya dan ia adalah keretanya sendiri yang dia telah cuba untuk memecah masuk ke dalam.
mt: Humans are the most gifted species in reading the minds of others. This means we can predict what is felt, desired, believed, known or wanted by other humans. Among these abilities, understanding the desires of others is very important. It allows us to solve the ambiguity of physical actions. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you will assume that he is trying to steal an unknown person's car. He will have to be evaluated differently if he has lost his car keys and it is his own car that he has tried to break into.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

Among these abilities, understanding the desires of others is very important. It allows us to solve the ambiguity of physical actions. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you will assume that he is trying to steal an unknown person's car. He will have to be evaluated differently if he has lost his car keys and it is his own car that he has tried to break into.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Walaupun AI mempunyai konotasi yang kuat dengan fiksyen sains, AI membentuk cawangan yang sangat penting dalam sains komputer, berurusan dengan sikap, pembelajaran dan penyesuaian pintar dalam mesin. Penyelidikan dalam Al melibatkan pembuatan mesin untuk mengautomasi tugasan yang memerlukan tingkah laku pintar. Contohnya termasuk kawalan, perancangan dan penjadualan, keupayaan untuk diagnosis pelanggan jawapan dan soalan, serta pengiktirafan tulisan tangan, suara dan muka. Perkara-perkara seperti ini telah menjadi disiplin yang berasingan, yang tertumpu pada penyediaan penyelesaian kepada masalah hidup sebenar. Sistem AI kini sering digunakan dalam bidang ekonomi, perubatan, kejuruteraan dan ketenteraan, seperti yang telah dibina dalam beberapa komputer rumah dan aplikasi perisian permainan video.
mt: Although AI has a strong connotation with science fiction, AI forms a very important branch in computer science, dealing with intelligence, learning and adaptation in machines. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to diagnose customer questions and answers, and handwriting, speech and face recognition. Such things have become separate disciplines, focused on providing solutions to real-life problems. AI systems are now often used in fields such as economics, medicine, engineering and military, as have been built into some home computers and video game software applications.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Pola pemikiran tertumpu adalah teknik menyelesaikan masalah menyatukan idea yang berbeza atau bidang untuk mencari penyelesaian. Fokus untuk set pemikiran ini adalah kelajuan, logik, dan ketepatan, serta pengenalpastian fakta, menggunakan semua teknik yang ada, serta mengumpul maklumat. Faktor paling penting untuk jenis pemikiran ini adalah terdapat hanya satu jawapan: Anda hanya berfikir tentang dua jawapan, iaitu betul atau salah. Pemikiran seperti ini adalah berkaitan dengan sains tertentu atau prosedur standard. Orang yang berfikiran sebegini mempunyai pemikiran logik, mampu untuk menghafal corak, menyelesaikan masalah dan mengusahakan ujian saintifik.
mt: Focused thinking is a problem-solving technique that combines different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this set of thoughts is speed, logic, and accuracy, as well as the identification of facts, using all available techniques, and gathering information. The most important factor for this type of thinking is there is only one answer: you only think about two answers, right or wrong. This type of thinking is related to certain sciences or standard procedures. People who think like this have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems, and conduct scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Penggunaan rakaman video telah membawa kepada penemuan penting dalam tafsiran ekspresi mikro, pergerakan wajah berlangsung beberapa milisaat. Khususnya, dikatakan bahawa seseorang dapat mengesan sama ada seseorang itu sedang berbohong dengan mentafsirkan perubahan kecil air muka dengan betul. Oliver Sacks, dalam kertas kerjanya Presiden Berucap, menunjukkan bagaimana orang-orang yang tidak dapat memahami pertuturan kerana kerosakan otak namun dapat menilai keikhlasan dengan tepat. Dia mencadangkan bahawa kebolehan dalam menterjemah tingkah laku manusia mungkin dikongsi oleh haiwan seperti anjing domestik.
mt: The use of video recordings has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements lasting a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether someone is lying by correctly interpreting subtle changes in facial expression. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, shows how people who cannot understand speech due to brain damage yet can accurately gauge sincerity. He suggests that the ability to interpret human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Kerana kebolehan untuk memperoleh pengetahuan dan untuk belajar telah berubah seperti yang dinyatakan di atas, kadar asas yang mana pengetahuan diperoleh telah berubah. Pendekatan untuk mendapatkan maklumat telah berbeza. Tekanan tidak lagi berada dalam ingatan individu, tetapi keupayaan untuk mengingatkan kembali teks lebih menjadi tumpuan. Pada dasarnya, Renaissance membuat perubahan penting dalam pendekatan kepada pembelajaran dan penyebaran ilmu.
mt: Because of the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn has changed as stated above, the basic rate at which knowledge is obtained has changed. Approaches to obtaining information have changed. Pressure is no longer in individual memory, but the ability to recall text is more focused. Basically, the Renaissance made a major change in the approach to learning and the spread of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Internet menggabungkan elemen-elemen massa dan komunikasi interpersonal. Ciri-ciri unik Internet membawa kepada dimensi tambahan dari segi pendekatan penggunaan dan kepuasan. Sebagai contoh, “pembelajaran” dan “pemasyarakatan” dicadangkan sebagai motivasi penting untuk penggunaan Internet (James et al, 1995). “Penglibatan peribadi” dan “hubungan berlanjutan” telah dikenalpasti sebagai aspek motivasi yang baru oleh Eighmey dan McCord (1998) apabila mereka menyiasat reaksi penonton kepada laman web.
mt: Internet combines mass and interpersonal communication elements. Unique Internet features bring additional dimensions in terms of usage and satisfaction approaches. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet usage (James et al, 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationship” have been identified as new motivational aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to web sites.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gaya Gothic memuncak dalam tempoh antara 10 - abad ke-11 dan abad ke-14. Pada permulaannya pakaian dipengaruhi kuat oleh kebudayaan Byzantine di timur. Namun begitu, disebabkan saluran komunikasi yang lambat, gaya di barat mungkin akan ketinggalan 25 hingga 30 tahun. Menjelang akhir Zaman Pertengahan, Eropah Barat mula membangunkan gaya mereka sendiri. Salah satu perkembangan terbesar pada masa itu akibat perang salib adalah orang ramai mula menggunakan butang untuk mengikat pakaian.
mt: Gothic fashion peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th and 14th centuries. At first, clothing was strongly influenced by Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to slow communication channels, styles in the west may have been lagging 25 to 30 years. By the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the biggest developments at the time due to the Crusades was the public began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Kita boleh memulakan hidup dengan mesra terhadap alam sekitar, kita dapat bergabung dengan gerakan lingkungan, malah kita boleh menjadi aktivis untuk mengurangkan penderitaan pada masa depan dalam tahap tertentu. Ini adalah sama seperti rawatan simptomatik dalam banyak kes. Namun begitu, jika kita tidak inginkan hanya penyelesaian sementara, maka kita harus mencari punca masalah dan menghapuskannya. Sudah cukup jelas bahawa dunia berubah dengan banyak kerana kemajuan saintifik dan teknologi manusia dan masalah menjadi lebih besar kerana penduduk yang berlebihan dan gaya hidup manusia yang mewah.
mt: We can start our lives with an environmentally friendly attitude, we can join the environmental movement, even we can be activists to reduce suffering in the future to some extent. This is similar to symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not want only temporary solutions, then we must find the cause of the problem and eliminate it. It is already clear that the world is changing a lot because of human scientific and technological progress and problems are getting bigger because of overpopulation and human luxurious lifestyle.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Keseimbangan kuasa merupakan sistem di mana negara-negara Eropah berusaha untuk mengekalkan kedaulatan nasional kesemua negeri Eropah. Konsepnya adalah semua negara Eropah harus berusaha untuk mencegah satu negara daripada menjadi berkuasa, dan oleh itu kerajaan kebangsaan sering menukar pakatan mereka untuk mengekalkan keseimbangan. Perang Pewarisan Sepanyol menandakan perang pertama yang mana keseimbangan kuasa merupakan persoalan pertama. Ini menandakan satu perubahan penting kerana kuasa-kuasa Eropah tidak lagi dapat menggunakan perang agama sebagai alasan. Oleh itu, Perang Tiga Puluh Tahun merupakan perang terakhir yang digelar sebagai perang agama.
mt: The Balance of Power is a system in which European countries try to maintain national sovereignty of all European countries. The concept is that all European countries should try to prevent one country from becoming too powerful, and thus governments often change their alliances to maintain the balance. The Spanish Succession War marked the first war in which the balance of power was the first issue. This marked a major change because the European powers could no longer use religious wars as an excuse. Thus, the Thirty Years' War was the last war to be called a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Selama zaman ini pada sejarah Eropah, Gereja Katolik, yang menjadi sangat kaya dan berkuasa, mula diragui. Selama lebih seribu tahun agama Kristian telah mengikat negara-negara Eropah bersama-sama walaupun perbezaan bahasa dan adat resam. Saya Kekuatan kuasa mutlaknya mempengaruhi setiap orang dari raja sehingga rakyat biasa. Satu dari teras utama Kristian adalah kekayaan harus digunakan untuk mengurangkan kemiskinan dan kesengsaraan dan dana kewangan gereja adalah khusus untuk sebab itu. Pihak berkuasa pusat gereja berada di Rome selama lebih seribu tahun dan kekuatan kuasa dan wang menyebabkan ramai mempersoalkan sama ada kepercayaan ini telah dipenuhi.
mt: During this time in European history, the Catholic Church, which had become very rich and powerful, began to be questioned. For over a thousand years Christianity had bound the nations of Europe together despite differences in language and custom. Its absolute power influenced everyone from kings to common people. One of the main tenets of Christianity is that wealth should be used to reduce poverty and suffering and church financial resources are specifically for that purpose. The central authority of the church was in Rome for over a thousand years and its power and wealth caused many to question whether this belief had been fulfilled.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Raja Louis XVI yang ketakutan, Permaisuri Marie Antoinette, dua anak kecil mereka (Marie Therese berusia 11 tahun dan Louis-Charles berusia empat tahun) dan kakak Raja, Madam Elizabeth, pada 6 Oktober 1789 telah dipaksa pulang ke Paris dari Versailles oleh sekumpulan wanita di pasar. Menaiki kereta kuda, mereka kembali ke Paris dan dikelilingi oleh sekumpulan orang yang menjerit dan berteriak memberi ancaman kepada Raja dan Permaisuri. Kumpulan perusuh telah memaksa Raja dan Ratu untuk membuka dengan luas tingkap pedati mereka. Pada suatu ketika, seorang ahli perusuh mengangkat kepala pengawal diraja yang terbunuh di versailles di hadapan Permaisuri yang sedang ketakutan.
mt: King Louis XVI, the terrified, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Marie Therese aged 11 and Louis-Charles aged four) and the King's sister, Madame Elizabeth, on October 6, 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of women at the market. Riding in a carriage, they returned to Paris and were surrounded by a mob of people who screamed and threatened the King and Queen. The mob had forced the King and Queen to open wide the carriage windows. At one point, a member of the mob lifted the head of the dead royal guard in front of the terrified Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Raja Louis XVI yang ketakutan, Permaisuri Marie Antoinette, dua anak kecil mereka (Marie Therese berusia 11 tahun dan Louis-Charles berusia empat tahun) dan kakak Raja, Madam Elizabeth, pada 6 Oktober 1789 telah dipaksa pulang ke Paris dari Versailles oleh sekumpulan wanita di pasar. Menaiki kereta kuda, mereka kembali ke Paris dan dikelilingi oleh sekumpulan orang yang menjerit dan berteriak memberi ancaman kepada Raja dan Permaisuri. Kumpulan perusuh telah memaksa Raja dan Ratu untuk membuka dengan luas tingkap pedati mereka. Pada suatu ketika, seorang ahli perusuh mengangkat kepala pengawal diraja yang terbunuh di versailles di hadapan Permaisuri yang sedang ketakutan.
mt: King Louis XVI, the terrified, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Marie Therese aged 11 and Louis-Charles aged four) and the King's sister, Madame Elizabeth, on October 6, 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of women at the market. Riding in a carriage, they returned to Paris and were surrounded by a mob of people who screamed and threatened the King and Queen. The mob had forced the King and Queen to open wide the carriage windows. At one point, a member of the mob lifted the head of the dead royal guard in front of the terrified Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Tidak lama selepas tercetusnya pertempuran, Britain memulakan sekatan tentera laut Jerman. Strategi berkenaan terbukti berkesan, memotong bekalan penting tentera dan orang awam, walaupun sekatan ini tidak mematuhi undang-undang antarabangsa yang diterima secara am yang diwujudakan oleh beberapa perjanjian antarabangsa dua abad yang lalu. Britain melombong air antarabangsa untuk mencegah mana-mana kapal dari masuk ke seluruh bahagian lautan, menyebabkan bahaya walaupun kapal biasa. Sejak ada tindak balas terhad kepada taktik ini, Jerman menjangkakan tindak balas yang sama dengan peperangan kapal selam tanpa had itu.
mt: Shortly after the outbreak of war, Britain began a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital supplies to both the military and the civilian population, although this blockade did not conform to the accepted international laws that had been established by several international treaties two centuries earlier. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ship from entering the entire ocean, causing danger even to ordinary ships. Since there was no response to this tactic, Germany expected the same response with the unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Di seluruh Amerika Syarikat, terdapat sekitar 400,000 kes Sklerosis Berbilang (MS) yang diketahui, yang membuatkannya menjadi penyakit neurologikal paling banyak pada dewasa muda dan pertengahan umur. MS ialah penyakit yang mempengaruhi sistem saraf pusat yang dibentuk daripada otak, saraf tunjang dan saraf optik. Kajian telah menunjukkan bahawa wanita dua kali lebih mungkin untuk menghidapi MS dari lelaki.
mt: In the United States, there are about 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), making it the most common neurological disease of young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerve. Studies have shown that women are twice as likely to develop MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Penyelidikan telah mendapati bahawa kemurungan, ketakutan dan sering berfikir bahawa keadaan lebih parah dari sebenarnya mempunyai kaitan dengan kesakitan dan kecacatan pada pesakit sakit belakang. Hanya kesan pemikiran kebencanaan, bukan kemurungan dan ketakutan yang bergantung pada sesi PA berstruktur mingguan biasa. Yang menyertai aktiviti biasa memerlukan lebih sokongan dari segi persepsi negatif kesakitan mengasingkan perbezaan kesakitan kronik dan rasa ketidakselesaan daripada pergerakan fizikal yang normal.
mt: Research has found that depression, fear and often thinking that the condition is worse than it actually is have a link with pain and disability in back patients. Only the effects of catastrophic thinking, not depression and fear, depend on a weekly, structured PA session. Those who participate in regular activity require more support in terms of negative pain perception distinguishing chronic pain and discomfort from normal physical movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Sukan moden lawan pedang dimainkan pada pelbagai tahap, daripada para pelajar yang mempelajarinya di universiti hingga tahap profesional dan pertandingan Olimpik. Sukan ini terutamanya dimainkan dalam format pertarungan, satu pemain berpusing yang lain.
mt: Modern fencing is played at various levels, from students who learn it at university to professional and Olympic competition levels. This sport is primarily played in the form of a duel, one player turning against the other.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Keracunan dalaman tidak boleh dibuktikan dengan cepat. Gejala-gejala, seperti muntah adalah cukup umum itu tidak boleh diagnosis dibuat dengan segera. Petunjuk terbaik untuk keracunan dalaman mungkin ialah peninggalan bekas ubat terbuka atau bahan pencuci rumah yang beracun. Semak label untuk arahan pertolongan cemas yang khusus untuk racun spesifik itu.
mt: Internal poisoning cannot be proven quickly. Symptoms, such as vomiting are common enough that a diagnosis cannot be made immediately. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the remains of an open prescription drug or toxic household cleaner. Check the label for specific emergency instructions for the specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Untuk Memeriksa keadaan mangsa anda mesti meninjau tempat kejadian terlebih dahulu untuk memastikan keselamatan anda. Anda perlu memerhatikan kedudukan mangsa semasa anda menghampirinya dan apa-apa amaran bahaya automatik. Jika anda tercedera kerana cuba membantu, anda mungkin menyebabkan keadaan menjadi lebih buruk.
mt: To check the condition of the victim, you must first inspect the scene to ensure your safety. You must observe the position of the victim as you approach and any automatic warning signs. If you are injured while trying to help, you may make the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Pelbagai kesan sosial dan politik akan wujud seperti penggunakan sistem metrik, perubahan dari pemerintahan mutlak kepada sistem republik, serta kesedaran dan semangat nasionalisme bahawa negara adalah milik rakyat dan bukan seorang pemimpin tunggal. Serta, selepas Revolusi, pekerjaan dibuka kepada semua pemohon lelaki yang membolehkan mereka yang paling bercita-cita tinggi dan berjaya untuk berjaya. Begitu juga dengan ketenteraan sebab sebalik kedudukan tentera berdasarkan kelas kini ia berdasarkan kaliber. Revolusi Perancis juga memberi inspirasi kepada ramai orang kelas pekerja yang ditindas dari negara-negara lain untuk memulakan revolusi mereka sendiri.
mt: Various social and political effects will occur such as the adoption of the metric system, the change from absolute monarchy to a republic, and the awareness and nationalism that the country is the people's and not a single leader's. Also, after the Revolution, jobs were opened to all male applicants allowing those with the highest aspirations and success to succeed. Likewise, with the military because of the previous class-based military it is now based on caliber. The French Revolution also inspired many oppressed working class people from other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Setiap orang mengambil bahagian dalam persatuan dan menggunakan sistem pengangkutan. Hampir semua orang mengadu mengenai sistem pengangkutan. Di negara maju anda jarang mendengar aduan yang serupa mengenai kualiti air atau jambatan yang jatuh. Mengapakah sistem pengangkutan mengakibatkan aduan sedemikian, mengapa ia gagal berfungsi setiap hari? Adakah ia disebabkan jurutera pengangkutan yang tidak cekap? Atau adakah terdapat sesuatu yang tidak kena pada peringkat asas?
mt: Everyone participates in a union and uses the transportation system. Almost everyone complains about the transportation system. In developed countries you rarely hear similar complaints about the quality of water or bridges that fall down. Why does the transportation system generate such complaints, why does it fail to function every day? Is it because incompetent transportation engineers? Or is there something wrong at the basic level?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Arus Trafik merupakan kajian tentang pergerakan pemandu individu dan kenderaan antara dua titik dan interaksi yang berlangsung antara satu sama lain. Malangnya, pengkajian aliran lalu lintas adalah sukar kerana kelakuan pemandu tidak dapat diramalkan dengan seratus peratus. Nasib baiklah, pemandu cenderung untuk berkelakuan secara agak konsisten; dengan itu, aliran trafik juga agak konsisten dan boleh diwakili dengan kasar secara matematik. Untuk mewakili aliran trafik yang lebih baik, hubungan telah ditubuhkan antara ketiga-tiga ciri-ciri utama: (1) mengalir, (2) ketumpatan, dan (3) halaju. Hubungan ini membantu dalam merancang, merekabentuk, dan operasi kemudahan jalanraya.
mt: Traffic flow is a study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions that occur between them. Unfortunately, traffic flow studies are difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one hundred percent accuracy. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave in a fairly consistent manner; thus, traffic flow is also fairly consistent and can be represented mathematically with some degree of accuracy. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Eksperimen Hershey dan Chase merupakan salah satu daripada cadangan utama bahawa DNA merupakan bahan genetik. Hershey dan Chase telah menggunakan faj, atau virus, untuk mengimplan DNA mereka sendiri ke dalam sebuah bakterium. Mereka melakukan dua ujian yang menanda sama ada DNA di dalam fag dengan fosforus radioaktif atau protein fag dengan belerang radioaktif.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was one of the main experiments that led to the conclusion that DNA is the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They performed two tests to determine whether the DNA in the phage was labeled with radioactive phosphorus or the phage protein was labeled with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutasi mempunyai pelbagai kesan yang berbeza bergantung kepada jenis mutasi, kepentingan sekeping bahan genetik terjejas dan sama ada sel-sel yang terlibat ialah sel-sel kuman. Hanya mutasi pada sel-sel titisan germa sahaja dapat diwarisi kanak-kanak, manakala mutasi di bahagian lain boleh menyebabkan kematian sel atau barah.
mt: Mutations have a variety of effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected piece of genetic material, and whether the affected cells are germ cells. Only mutations in germ cells can be inherited by children, while mutations in other parts can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Kambing nampaknya telah pertama kali dijinakkan kira-kira 10,000 tahun dahulu di Pergunungan Zagros di Iran. Budaya dan kaum kuno mula menternaknya untuk mendapat susu, bulu, daging dan kulit dengan lebih mudah. Kambing domestik secara umumnya dipelihara dalam kawanan yang merayau di bukit atau padang ragut lain, sering dijaga oleh penggembala kambing yang biasanya kanak-kanak atau remaja, serupa dengan gembala lebih dikenali sekarang. Kaedah penggembalaan ini masih digunakan hingga kini.
mt: Goats appear to have been first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Cultures and ancient tribes began to tame them for milk, wool, meat and skin more easily. Goats are generally kept in herds that graze together, usually under the supervision of one or more herding dogs. This method of herding is still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf ialah permainan di mana pemain menggunakan belatan untuk memukul bola ke dalam lubang. Lapan belas lubang dimainkan semasa pusingan biasa, lazimnya pemain akan memulakan permainan pada lubang pertama dalam lapangan golf dan berakhir pada lubang kelapan belas. Pemain yang mengambil sedikit pukulan, atau hayunan, untuk menyelesaikan kursus. Permainan ini dimainkan atas rumput, dan rumput sekitar lubang dipotong lebih pendek dan dipanggil “green”
mt: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a normal round, usually players will start the game on the first hole in the golf course and end on the eighteenth hole. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings, to complete the course. This game is played on grass, and grass around the holes is cut shorter and called “green”
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Matlamat utama sains adalah untuk mengetahui cara dunia berfungsi melalui kaedah saintifik. Kaedah ini sebenarnya membimbing kebanyakan penyelidikan saintifik. Ia tidak bersendirian, eksperimentasi dan eksperimen adalah ujian yang digunakan untuk menyingkirkan satu atau lebih daripada hipotesis yang mungkin, bertanya soalan dan membuat pemerhatian juga membimbing penyelidikan saintifik.
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the world works through the scientific method. This method is actually guiding most scientific research. It is not alone, experimentation and experiments are tests used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions and making observations also guide scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornado menyerang kawasan kecil berbanding ribut kencang yang lain, tetapi ia boleh memusnahkan segala yang menembungnya. Puting beliung mencabut pokok, merosakkan bangunan dan menerbangkan kereta. Dua peratus puting beliung yang paling ganas berlaku lebih dari tiga jam. Ribut ganas ini bertiup kencang sehingga 480 km/jam (133 m/s; 300 bsj).
mt: Tornadoes strike small areas compared to other storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes rip up trees, damage buildings and blow cars around. Two percent of the most violent tornadoes last more than three hours. This violent storm blew at up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Manusia telah membuat dan menggunakan lensa untuk pembesaran selama beribu-ribu tahun. Walau bagaimanapun, teleskop sebenar dibuat di Eropah pada akhir abad ke-16. Teleskop-teleskop tersebut menggunakan kombinasi dua lensa untuk membuat objek jauh kelihatan lebih dekat dan besar.
mt: Humans have made and used lenses for magnification for thousands of years. However, the real telescope was made in Europe at the end of the 16th century. Telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Muhammad SAW sangat berminat dengan hal yang di luar kehidupan biasa ini. Baginda sering berkunjung ke sebuah gua yang kemudian dikenali sebagai “Hira” di Gunung Noor (cahaya) untuk berfikir. dia mengorek sendiri, bertahan sepanjang masa, memberikan imej yang sangat jelas kecenderungan rohani Muhammad. Terletak di puncak sebuah gunung di utara Mekah, gua ini terpencil sepenuhnya daripada seluruh dunia. Ia sebenarnya tidak mudah dijumpai walaupun seseorang mengetahui kewujudannya. Selepas melangkah masuk ke gua ini, ia sunyi sepenuhnya. Tiada apa-apa yang dapat dilihat selain langit yang terang dan indah dan gunung-ganang di sekitarnya. Hanya bisikan dunia dapat didengar atau dilihat dari dalam gua ini.
mt: Muhammad was very interested in this life outside the ordinary. He often visited a cave called "Hira" on Mount Noor (light) to think. He dug it himself, enduring the whole time, giving a very clear image of Muhammad's spiritual inclination. Located at the top of a mountain north of Mecca, this cave is completely isolated from the whole world. It is actually not easy to find even if someone knows its existence. After entering the cave, it is completely silent. Nothing can be seen except the bright and beautiful sky and mountains around it. Only the whispers of the world can be heard or seen from within this cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Gerabak telah dibina di Inggeris seawal abad ke-16. Walaupun landasan gerabak hanya terdiri daripada papan kayu selari, ia membolehkan kuda menariknya bagi mencapai kelajuan yang lebih tinggi dan menarik beban yang lebih berat berbanding jalan yang lebih kasar pada zaman itu. Ikatan silang diperkenalkan agak awal untuk memegang trek setempat. Landai, bagaimanapun, ia disedari bahawa trek akan lebih efisien jika ia ada jalur besi pada bahagian atas. Ini telah menjadi kebiasaan, tetap besi tersebut telah membuat roda kayu gerabak tersebut menjadi haus. Lama-kelamaan, roda kayu diganti dengan roda besi. Pada tahun 1767, landasan besi sepenuhnya yang pertama dilancarkan.
mt: Wagons were built in England as early as the 16th century. Although the wagon track consisted only of parallel wooden planks, it allowed horses to pull it at higher speeds and pull heavier loads than the rougher roads of the time. Cross ties were introduced early to hold the local track. However, it was realized that the track would be more efficient if it had an iron strip on top. This became the norm, but the iron strip made the wooden wagon wheels wear out. Eventually, wooden wagon wheels were replaced with iron wheels. In 1767, the first fully ironed track was launched.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
