src: Romantisme mempunyai unsur besar determinisme budaya, terinspirasi oleh penulis seperti Goethe, Fichte, dan Schlegel. Dalam konteks Romantisisme, geografi membentuk individu, dan dengan masa yang berlalu muncul adat dan budaya yang berkaitan dengan geografi ini. Dan ini, yang lebih harmoni dengan kedudukan masyarakat, lebih baik daripada undang-undang yang dikenakan dengan sewenang-wenangnya.
mt: Romanticism has a large cultural determinism, inspired by writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, geography shapes individuals, and over time, customs and culture related to this geography emerge. And this, which is more harmonious with the position of society, is better than laws imposed arbitrarily.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: Determinisme teknologi adalah istilah yang merangkumi pelbagai idea yang diamalkan, daripada kemajuan teknologi atau keutamaan teknologi hingga perasaan tegas bahawa takdir manusia didorong oleh logik yang berkaitan dengan undang-undang saintifik yang dimanifestasi menerusi teknologi. Kebanyak interpretasi determinisme teknologi berkongsi dua ide am: bahwa pengembangan teknologi itu sendiri mengikut jalan di luar pengaruh budaya atau politik, dan teknologi pula ada “kesan” terhadap masyarakat yang wujud, daripada keadaan sosial. Sebagai contoh, seorang mungkin mengatakan bahawa kenderaan bermotor membawa kepada pembangunan jalan raya. Walau bagaimanapun, rangkaian jalan raya di seluruh negara tidak berdaya maju untuk hanya beberapa kereta, jadi kaedah baharu pengeluaran dibangunkan untuk mengurangkan kos pemilikan kereta. Pemilikan kereta yang sangat tinggi juga mengakibatkan peningkatan kemalangan jalan raya yang membawa kepada penciptaan teknik baharu dalam penjagaan kesihatan bagi memulihkan bahagian badan yang tercedera.
mt: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a variety of ideas from the advancement of technology or the primacy of technology to a strong feeling that the fate of humanity is driven by the logic associated with scientific laws that are manifested through technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two basic ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path independent of cultural or political influence, and that technology itself has an "effect" on the society that exists, from social conditions. For example, one might say that the automobile led to the development of highways. However, the highway system throughout the country would not have advanced for just a few cars, so new methods of production were developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. High car ownership also led to increased highway accidents, which led to the creation of new techniques in health care to repair injured body parts.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: Tanda “penggesek naik” adalah serupa huruf V dan “penggesek turun” adalah serupa bentuk ruji atau segiempat sama tanpa bahagian bawah. Atas bermaksud, anda harus bermula dari hujung dan menolak busur, dan bawah bermaksud, anda harus bermula pada frog (bahagian yang mana tangan anda memegang busur) dan tarik busur. Sebuah up bow biasanya menghasilkan bunyi yang lembut sementara down-bow menghasilkan bunyi yang lebih kuat dan asertif. Bebas untuk menulis tanda-tanda anda sendiri, tetapi perlu diingatkan bahwa tanda tunduk yang dicetak berada di situ untuk tujuan muzik. Oleh itu mereka sepatutnya slalu dihormati.
mt: The up bow sign is similar to the letter V and the down bow sign is similar to a rectangle or square without the bottom. Up means you should start from the end and push the curve, and down means you should start on the frog (the part where your hand holds the curve) and pull the curve. An up bow usually produces a soft sound while a down bow produces a stronger and assertive sound. Feel free to write your own signs, but it should be remembered that printed signs are there for musical purposes. So they should always be respected.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Tidak seperti primat lain, hominid tidak lagi menggunakan tangan mereka semasa bergerak atau menanggung beban atau berayun dari pokok ke pokok. Tangan dan kaki seekor cimpanzi mempunyai ukuran dan panjang yang sama, yang menunjukkan penggunaan tangan untuk menanggung beban semasa berjalan dengan buku jari. Tangan manusia adalah lebih pendek daripada kaki, dengan tulang falanks yang lebih lurus. Tulang tangan fosil berusia dua juta hingga tiga juta tahun mendedahkan peralihan pengkhususan tangan dari pergerakan ke manipulasi.
mt: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands while walking or carrying loads or swinging from tree to tree. A chimpanzee's hands and feet have the same size and length, indicating the use of hands to carry loads while walking on two legs. Human hands are shorter than feet, with the phalanges more straight. Two-million- to three-million-year-old fossil hands reveal the transition of hands from movement to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Kajian abad kedua puluh telah menunjukkan bahawa terdapat dua jenis kumpulan variasi genetik: yang tersembunyi dan yang nyata. Perubahan genetik baharu pertambahan mutasi dan pemilihan mengeluarkan dari himpunan perubahan yang ditonjolkan. Pengasingan dan gabungan semula merombak variasi antara dua kumpulan dengan setiap generasi.
mt: 20th century studies have shown that there are two types of genetic variation groups: hidden and obvious. New mutations and selection remove from the highlighted group of changes. Isolation and recombination remixes variation between two groups with each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: Di savanna, sangat susah untuk seekor primat dengan sistem pencernaan seperti manusia untuk memenuhi keperluan asid amino dari sumber tanaman yang sedia ada. Tambahan pula, kegagalan untuk berbuat demikian akan ada akibat-akibat yang serius: peningkatan depresi, pemakanan tak seimbang, dan berakhir dengan kematian. Sumber tanaman yang paling mudah didapati ialah protein yang terdapat dalam dedaun dan kekacang, tetapi ini sukar untuk dihadam oleh primat seperti kita kecuali jika ia dimasak. Sebaliknya, makanan haiwan (semut, anai-anai, telur) bukan sahaja mudah dihadam, tetapi ia menyediakan protein berkuantiti tinggi yang mengandungi semua asid amino yang penting. Semua perkara dipertimbangkan, kita sepatutnya tidak boleh terkejut jika nenek moyang kita mengatasi “masalah protein” mereka dengan cara yang sama seperti cimp di savanna lakukan hari ini.
mt: In the savanna, it is very difficult for a primate with a digestive system like ours to meet the requirements of amino acids from the available plant sources. In addition, failure to do so will have serious consequences: depression, malnutrition, and ending in death. The most readily available plant sources are proteins found in leaves and legumes, but these are difficult to digest by primates like us unless they are cooked. Instead, animal food (ants, termites, eggs) not only is easily digested, but it provides high protein quantities that contain all the important amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our ancestors overcame their "protein problem" in the same way that chimps in the savanna do today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Subkebudayaan menyatukan individu yang berfikiran sama yang merasakan mereka diabaikan oleh standard masyarakat dan membolehkan mereka untuk mengembangkan jati diri. Subbudaya boleh dibezakan berdasarkan umur, etnik, kelas, lokasi dan/atau jantina ahlinya. Kualiti yang menentukan cabang kebudayaan yang berbeza mungkin adalah linguistik, estetika, agama, politik seksual, geografi atau gabungan faktor. Ahli-ahli sesuatu cabang kebudayaan lazimnya mempamerkan keanggotaan mereka melalui stail tertentu secara simbolik, sama ada dalam bentuk fesyen, tingkahlaku, dan bahasa.
mt: Subcultures unite individuals who feel they are ignored by mainstream society and allow them to develop their identities. Subcultures can be distinguished by age, ethnicity, class, location and/or gender of its members. The quality that distinguishes different branches of culture may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, sexual politics, geography or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture usually display their membership through a certain style symbolically, whether in the form of fashion, behavior, and language.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Kanak-kanak mengembangkan suatu kesedaran tentang perkauman dan stereotaip perkauman pada usia muda, dan stereotaip perkauman tersebut berpengaruh pada tingkah laku. Sebagai contoh, kanak-kanak yang mengenali diri mereka sebagai dari satu kaum minoriti yang distereotaip sebagai tidak menunjukkan prestasi baik di sekolah cenderung untuk tidak menunjukkan prestasi baik di sekolah apabila mereka belajar tentang stereotaip yang dikaitkan dengan bangsa mereka.
mt: Children develop a sense of their own group membership and stereotypes about their group at a young age, and these stereotypes influence behavior. For example, children who identify as members of a minority group that is stereotyped as not doing well in school are likely to do worse in school when they learn about the stereotypes associated with their group.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: Salah satu kaedah yang paling biasa digunakan untuk menggambarkan kepentingan sosialisasi adalah untuk mengambil kira beberapa kes malang kanak-kanak pengabaian, musibah, atau penderaan dengan sengaja, tidak bersosial dengan orang dewasa ketika mereka besar. Kanak-kanak seperti itu digelar “feral” atau liar. Beberapa kanak-kanak feral telah dikurung oleh orang (biasanya ibu bapa sendiri); dalam beberapa kes pengabaian anak ini disebabkan oleh ibu bapa menolak kecacatan teruk intelektual atau fizikal kanak-kanak tersebut. Kanak-kanak feral mungkin telah mengalami penderaan kanak-kanak yang parah atau trauma sebelum ditinggalkan atau melarikan diri. Kanak-kanak lain didakwa dibesarkan oleh haiwan; sesetengahnya dikatakan tinggal bersendirian di dalam hutan. Apabila dibesarkan sepenuhnya oleh haiwan bukan manusia, seorang kanak-kanak feral akan menunjukkan tingkah laku (dalam batas fizikal) hampir sepenuhnya seperti haiwan yang menjaganya, seperti sifat takut atau tidak peduli akan manusia.
mt: One of the most common ways of describing the importance of socialization is to consider some unfortunate cases of child neglect, accidents, or deliberate abuse, not socializing with adults as they grow up. Children like that are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases child neglect is caused by parents rejecting the children's severe intellectual or physical disabilities. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Other children are claimed to be raised by animals; some are said to live alone in the woods. When raised entirely by non-human animals, a feral child will exhibit behavior (within physical limits) almost entirely like the animal that is caring for it, such as fear or indifference to humans.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Pertanian sara diri adalah pertanian yang dilaksanakan untuk menghasilkan makanan untuk keperluan ahli pertanian dan keluar mereka. Pertanian sara diri adalah sistem yang mudah, selalunya organik, yang menggunakan benih yang disimpan yang berasal dari satu-satu kawasan ekologi dan digabungkan dengan penggiliran tanaman atau lain-lain teknik yang agak mudah untuk memaksimumkan hasil. Mengikut sejarah, kebanyakan petani terlibat dalam pertanian sebagai saraan hidup, dan ini masih hakikat dalam banyak negara berkembang.
mt: Subsistence farming is farming done for the purpose of producing food for the farmer and his or her family. Subsistence farming is a simple, often organic, system that uses saved seed from one particular ecological area and combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. According to history, most farmers were involved in farming as a subsistence, and this is still a fact in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Jenis pelancongan yang paling biasa ialah jenis yang kebanyakan orang mengaitkan dengan percutian: Pelancongan rekreasi. Inilah apabila orang pergi ke sebuah tempat yang sangat berbeza dari kehidupan sehari-hari biasa mereka untuk berehat dan bersenang-senang. Pantai, taman tema dan tapak perkhemahan menjadi tempat paling sering dikunjung oleh pelancong rekreasi. Jika objektif lawatan seseorang ke tempat tertentu adalah untuk mengetahui sejarah dan budayanya, dengan in ia adalah jenis pelancongan dikenali sebagai pelancongan budaya. Pelancong boleh melawat mercu tanda berbeza-beza di sebuah negara tertentu atau mereka boleh memilih untuk fokus pada satu daerah sahaja.
mt: The most common type of tourism is the type that most people associate with vacations: recreational tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their everyday ordinary lives to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and campgrounds are the most visited by recreational tourists. If the purpose of someone's visit to a certain place is to learn about its history and culture, with it is known as cultural tourism. Tourists can visit different landmarks in a certain country or they can choose to focus on one area only.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Individu yang telah terlibat untuk beberapa dekad membantu kami menghargai kekuatan dan keghairahan kami sambil terus terang menilai kesukaran dan juga kegagalan. Semasa mendengar individu berkongsi cerita individu, keluarga, dan organisasi mereka, kami mendapat wawasan bernilai tentang masa lalu dan beberapa personaliti yang mempengaruhi budaya organisasi secara baik atau buruk. Walaupun pemahaman sejarah seseorang tidak bermaksud pemahaman budaya mereka, sekurang-kurangnya ia membantu orang lain mengetahui kedudukan mereka dalam sejarah organisasi tersebut. Ketika menilai kejayaan dan menyedari kegagalan, individu dan seluruh orang yang menyertai menemui lebih mendalam nilai-nilai, misi, dan memandu kuasa-kuasa organisasi. Dalam hal ini, mengingatkan keadaan sebelum tingkah laku keusahawanan dan hasil kejayaan membantu orang untuk menjadi terbuka kepada perubahan baharu dan hala tuju baharu untuk gereja tempatan. Kisah kejayaan seperti ini mengurangkan ketakutan akan perubahan, sekaligus mewujudkan kecenderungan positif ke arah perubahan pada masa hadapan.
mt: Individuals who have been involved for decades in helping us appreciate our strength and enthusiasm while continuing to openly evaluate the difficulties and also failures. While hearing individuals share their stories, families, and organizations, we gain insights into the past and some personalities that influence the organization's culture well or badly. Although an understanding of someone's history does not mean an understanding of their culture, at least it helps others know their place in the organization's history. When evaluating successes and realizing failures, individuals and the entire people involved find more deeply the values, mission, and guiding forces of the organization. In this case, reminding the condition before entrepreneurial behavior and successful results help people to be open to new changes and new directions for the local church. Stories of success like this reduce fears of change, while creating a positive trend towards change in the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Pendekatan pascamoden terhadap pembelajaran menawarkan kebebasan daripada prinsip mutlak. Tiada satu kaedah tunggal yang baik untuk belajar. Sebenarnya tidak ada satu perkara yang baik untuk dipelajari. Pembelajaran berlaku dalam pengalaman antara pelajar dan pengetahuan yang disampaikan. Rancangan televisyen berasaskan pembelajaran menggambarkan pengalaman semasa berkaitan kemahiran kendiri dan cara penyampaian maklumat. Sebilangan besar daripada kita menonton rancangan televisyen yang memaklumkan tentang proses atau pengalaman yang mungkin tidak kita lalui mahupun menggunakan pengetahuan tersebut. Kami tidak akan membuat membaik pulih kereta, membina air pancut di halaman belakang, melancong ke Peru untuk meneroka runtuhan kuno, atau merombak rumah jiran kami.
mt: Postmodern approaches to learning offer freedom from absolutes. There is no single good way to learn. In fact, there is no single thing that is good to learn. Learning happens in the experience between the learner and the knowledge being conveyed. Television learning programs depict experiences related to self skills and ways of conveying information. Most of us watch television programs that inform about processes or experiences that we may not go through or use the knowledge for. We will not fix cars, build a water fountain in the backyard, travel to Peru to explore ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Gangguan tidur ialah proses bangun secara sengaja selama tempoh tidur normal anda dan tertidur sekejap (10-60 minit). Ini dapat dilakukan dengan mudah menggunakan jam penggera senyap untuk sedar tanpa membangunkan anda sepenuhnya. Jika anda mendapati diri anda mengeset semula jam dalam tidur anda, jam boleh diletakkan di sebelah bahagian lain bilik, memaksa anda untuk bangun dari katil untuk mematikannya. Pilihan berdasarkan biorhythm lain yang melibatkan minuman cecair yang banyak (terutamanya air atau teh, diuretik yang tidak diketahui) sebelum tidur, memaksa seseorang bangun untuk kencing.
mt: Sleep disruption is the process of waking up deliberately during your normal sleep period and falling asleep again (10-60 minutes). This can be done easily using a silent alarm clock to wake you up without fully waking you up. If you find yourself resetting your alarm in your sleep, the clock can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involving large amounts of liquid (especially water or tea, unknown diuretics) before sleep, forcing someone to wake up to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Beberapa orang percaya bahawa mengalami mimpi jelas secara buatan dengan sering sangat memenatkan. Penyebab utama fenomena ini adalah hasil daripada mimpi jelas yang memanjangkan waktu antara keadaan tidur REM. Dengan REM yang berkurangan pada setiap malam, keadaan apabila anda mendapat tidur nyenyak dan badan anda semakin pulih serta tidak lagi kerap menimbulkan masalah. Ia sama penat seperti kita terbangun setiap dua puluh atau tiga puluh minit dan menonton TV. Kesan nya adalah bergantung kepada kekerapan otak anda cuba bermimpi jernih setiap malam.
mt: Some people believe that experiencing lucid dreams artificially with drugs is very tiring. The main cause of this phenomenon is the result of lucid dreams that extend the time between REM states. With REM reduced each night, the state when you get a good night's sleep and your body is getting better and no longer often causing problems. It is as tiring as waking up every twenty or thirty minutes and watching TV. The effects are dependent on how often your brain tries to dream lucid every night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Beberapa orang percaya bahawa mengalami mimpi jelas secara buatan dengan sering sangat memenatkan. Penyebab utama fenomena ini adalah hasil daripada mimpi jelas yang memanjangkan waktu antara keadaan tidur REM. Dengan REM yang berkurangan pada setiap malam, keadaan apabila anda mendapat tidur nyenyak dan badan anda semakin pulih serta tidak lagi kerap menimbulkan masalah. Ia sama penat seperti kita terbangun setiap dua puluh atau tiga puluh minit dan menonton TV. Kesan nya adalah bergantung kepada kekerapan otak anda cuba bermimpi jernih setiap malam.
mt: Some people believe that experiencing lucid dreams artificially with drugs is very tiring. The main cause of this phenomenon is the result of lucid dreams that extend the time between REM states. With REM reduced each night, the state when you get a good night's sleep and your body is getting better and no longer often causing problems. It is as tiring as waking up every twenty or thirty minutes and watching TV. The effects are dependent on how often your brain tries to dream lucid every night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Pasukan maya dipegang pada standard yang sama dengan kecemerlangan sebagai pasukan konvensional, tetapi perbezaan yang tidak ketara. Anggota pasukan maya sering kali berfungsi sebagai titik hubungan untuk kumpulan fizikal yang berdekatan. Mereka biasanya mempunyai lebih autonomi daripada ahli pasukan konvensional oleh sebab pasukan mereka mungkin bertemu mengikut zon waktu yang berbeza yang mungkin tidak difahami oleh pengurusan tempatan mereka. Kehadiran “pasukan tidak kelihatan” benar (Larson dan LaFasto, 1989, p109) juga merupakan komponen unik dari pasukan maya. “Pasukan yang tidak kelihatan” merupakan pasukan pengurusan di mana semua ahli melapor. Pasukan yang tidak kelihatan ini menetapkan standard untuk setiap ahli.
mt: Mayan teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but subtle differences. Members of mayan teams often serve as a point of contact for nearby physical teams. They usually have more autonomy than conventional team members because their teams may meet in different time zones that may not be understood by local management. The presence of “invisible teams” is also a unique component of mayan teams. “Invisible teams” are management teams where all members report. Invisible teams set standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Teori kandungan tertumpu kepada mencari apa yang membuat orang tik atau rayuan kepada mereka. Teori-teori ini menunjukkan bahawa manusia mempunyai keperluan dan/atau keinginan tertentu yang telah sebati apabila mereka mencapai kematangan sebagai orang dewasa. Teori-teori ini melihat apa yang terdapat dalam seseorang yang membuat mereka inginkan benda-benda yang mereka inginkan dan perkara di persekitaran mereka yang akan membuat mereka melakukan atau tidak melakukan perkara-perkara tertentu. Dua teori kandungan yang popular ialah Hierarki Keperluan Maslow dan Teori Dua Faktor Hertzberg.
mt: Content theories focus on what makes people tick or what attracts them. These theories show that people have certain needs and/or desires that have become ingrained when they reach maturity as adults. These theories look at what is in someone that makes them want things they want and things in their environment that will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Peraturan sepertiga yang sering disalahgunakan dan dicemuh ialah garis panduan ringkas yang mewujudkan dinamisme sambil mengekalkan ukuran tertib dalam imej. Ia menyatakan bahawa tempat paling berkesan untuk subjek utama adalah di persilangan antara garis yang membahagikan imej tersebut menjadi tiga secara menegak dan melintang (lihat contoh).
mt: 1/3 rule, often abused and derided, is a simple guideline that creates dynamism while maintaining order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of the lines that divide the image into three vertically and horizontally (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Sebagai contoh, imej yang paling biasa dalam format fortografi di dunia ilh 35mm, yang bersamaan dengan saiz dominan filem pada hujung era filem analog. Ia masih dihasilkan sehingga kini, tetapi lebih penting dari itu, nisbah aspek telah diwarisi oleh format pengesan imej kamera digital. Format 35mm sebenarnya, agak mengelirukan, 36mm lebar kali 24mm tinggi. Nisbah aspek format ini (terbahagi kepada dua belas bagi mendapatkan nisbah keseluruhan yang paling mudah) yang dikatakan 3:2. Banyak format biasa (contohnya format dari keluarga APS) adalah sama atau hampir sama dengan nisbah aspek ini.
mt: 35mm is the most common image format in the world of photography, corresponding to the dominant film size at the end of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly, the aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The actual 35mm format, however, is 36mm wide by 24mm high. The aspect ratio of this format (divided by twelve to get the easiest overall ratio) is said to be 3:2. Many common formats (such as those in the APS family) are the same or nearly the same as this aspect ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Kekurangan lensa zoom adalah kerumitan fokal dan bilangan unsur lensa yang diperlukan untuk mencapai panjang fokal berbeza yang lebih luas berbanding untuk lensa perdana. Perkara ini kurang menjadi isu kerana pengilang kanta telah mencapai standard yang lebih tinggi dalam pengeluaran kanta. Ini telah membolehkan kanta zum menghasilkan gambar yang berkualiti setanding dengan yang dicapai oleh kanta dengan jarak fokus tetap. Kelemahan lain lensa zoom ialah bukaan maksimum (kelajuan) lensa lazimnya lebih rendah. Ini menjadikan kanta zoom berharga murah sukar untuk digunakan pada keadaan pencahayaan rendah tanpa cahaya kamera.
mt: The lack of zoom lenses is the complexity of focal length and the number of lens elements required to achieve a wider focal length range than for the prime lens. This is less of an issue because lens manufacturers have achieved higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce images of equal quality to those achieved by fixed focal length lenses. Another weakness of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes cheap zoom lenses difficult to use in low light conditions without flash.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Mistisisme adalah usaha untuk bersatu dengan, identiti dengan, atau kesedaran akan realiti, ketuhanan, kebenaran rohani, atau Tuhan. Seorang penganut mencari pengalaman, naluri atau pemahaman secara langsung tentang hakikat ketuhanan/dewa atau dewa-dewi. Pengikut meneruskan cara hidup tertentu, atau amalan yang bertujuan untuk meningkatkan pengalaman mereka. Mistisisme berbeza daripada kepercayaan agama lain dan cara penyembahannya bertumpu kepada pengalaman peribadi langsung dalam keadaan penuh kesedaran, khas untuk mereka yang tenang, berwawasan, bahagia, bahkan bersifat gembira yang melampau.
mt: Mysticism is the attempt to unite with, identify with, or become aware of reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. A mystic seeks direct experience, intuition, or understanding of the divine or god. Followers pursue a certain way of life, or practices intended to enhance their experiences. Mysticism differs from other religious beliefs and its worship is based on personal direct experience in a state of full awareness, especially for those who are calm, insightful, happy, even ecstatic.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Untuk masa yang lama pada abad kesembilan belas dan kedua puluh, ia dipercayai penduduk di New Zealand yang pertama adalah orang Maori, yang diburu burung gergasi dipanggil MoA. Teori tersebut kemudian menetapkan idea bahawa orang Maori telah berhijrah dari Polinesia dalam Great Fleet dan telah merampas New Zealand dari Moriori, lalu mewujudkan masyarakat agrikultur. Namun begitu, bukti baru menunjukkan bahawa Moriori ialah sekumpulan Maori daratan yang berhijrah dari New Zealand ke Kepulauan Chatham, dan mengembangkan budaya mereka yang tersendiri dan damai. Terdapat sebuah lagi puak di Pulau Chatham, mereka adalah Maori yang berhijrah keluar dari New Zealand. Mereka menggelar diri mereka sebagai orang Moriori, terjadi beberapa pertempuran dan akhirnya orang Moriori dihapuskan.
mt: For a long time in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori, who hunted the giant birds called MoA. The theory then established the idea that the Maori had migrated from Polynesia in the Great Fleet and had seized New Zealand from the Moriori, then creating an agricultural society. However, new evidence shows that the Moriori were a group of Maori land who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, and developed their own culture and peaceful. There was another tribe on Chatham Island, they were the Maori who migrated out of New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori, there were some battles and eventually the Moriori were exterminated.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Pureland origami adalah origami dengan had yang hanya satu kali ganda boleh dilakukan pada satu masa, lipatan yang lebih rumit seperti lipatan terbalik tidak dibenarkan, dan semua lipatan mempunyai lokasi mudah. Perkara ini telah dibangunkan oleh John Smith pada tahun 1970-an untuk membantu pelipat yang tidak berpengalaman atau sesiapa yang mempunyai kemahiran motor yang terhad.
mt: Pureland origami is origami with a restriction that only one fold can be done at a time, complex folds such as reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have easy locations. This was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help beginners or anyone with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Tamadun Lembah Indus ialah tamadun Zaman Gangsa di benua kecil barat laut India yang merangkumi sebahagian besar Pakistan moden dan beberapa wilayah di barat laut India dan timur laut Afghanistan. Peradaban menyubur dalam lembangan Sungai Indus sebab musabab asal namanya. Walaupun beberapa cendekiawan membuat spekulasi bahawa disebabkan tamadun itu juga wujud di lembah Sungai Sarasvati yang kini kering kontang, ia sepatutnya dipanggil Tamadun Indus-Sarasvati, sementara ada yang memanggilnya Tamadun Harappan sempena Harappa, tapak pertama yang digali pada tahun 1920-an.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in South Asia, dating from the 33rd to 13th centuries BCE. It is one of the three oldest civilizations in the world, along with the Minoan and Egyptian civilizations. The civilization is named after the Indus River, which flows through the valley of the Indus River and the Punjab region of Pakistan and India. The Indus Valley Civilization is also known as the Harappan Civilization, after the type site of Harappa, the first of the sites to be discovered and excavated.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Sifat tamak dan mementingkan diri sendiri akan selalu bersama-sama kita, dan sememangnya merupakan kebiasaan bagi kerjasama apabila majoriti mendapat manfaat maka lebih banyak dapat diperoleh dalam jangka pendek dengan bertindak mementingkan diri sendiri Semoga kebanyakan orang akan sedar bahawa pilihan terbaik jangka panjang adalah untuk bekerjasama dengan orang lain.
mt: Greed and selfishness will always be with us, and it is certainly a habit for cooperation when the majority benefit then more can be obtained in the short term by acting selfishly. Hopefully most people will realize that the best long-term choice is to cooperate with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Perbelanjaan perang imperialisme A.S. untuk menakluk Filipina telah dibayar oleh rakyat Filipina sendiri. Mereka terpaksa membayar cukai kepada rejim kolonial Amerika Syarikat untuk menanggung sebahagian besar perbelanjaan dan faedah bon terapung atas nama kerajaan Filipina melalui rumah pembankan Wall Street. Sudah tentu, keuntungan yang hebat berkaitan dari eksploitasi berlarutan rakyat Filipina yang akan menjadi keuntungan asas imperialisme A.S.
mt: The cost of the American imperialist war to conquer the Philippines was paid by the Filipino people themselves. They had to pay taxes to the American colonial regime to bear most of the cost and floating bond interest in the name of the Philippine government through Wall Street houses. Of course, the great profits related to the ongoing exploitation of the Filipino people would become the basic profit of American imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Untuk memahami pihak Templars, seorang perlu memahami konteks yang telah mencetus pewujudan perintah berkenaan. Zaman di mana peristiwa berlaku biasnya dikenali sebagai Zaman Pertengahan Tinggi tempoh sejarah Eropah dalam abad ke 11, 12 dan 13 (AD 1000 -1300) Zaman Pertengahan Tinggi didahului oleh Zaman Pertengahan Awal dan diikuti Zaman Pertengahan Akhir, yang secara konvensyen berakhir sekitar tahun 1500.
mt: To understand the Templars, one must understand the context in which the order was created. The time period in which the events took place is generally known as the High Middle Ages, a period of European history in the 11th, 12th and 13th centuries (AD 1000-1300). The High Middle Ages was preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which conventionally ended around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Sifat ketenteraan empayar Yunani telah membantu dalam perkembangan kemajuan perubatan. Doktor mula direkrut oleh Maharaja Augustus dan juga membentuk Kor Perubatan Rom yang pertama yang digunakan untuk menangani mangsa peperangan. Pakar bedah mempunyai pengetahuan tentang berbagai jenis sedatif termasuk morfin dari pati biji bunga popi dan scopolamine dari biji herba. Mereka menjadi mahir dalam amputasi untuk menyelamatkan pesakit daripada gangren serta pemasangan kain anduh dan pengapit arteri untuk menahan aliran darah. Selama beberapa abad, empayar Rom membawa kemajuan besar dalam bidang perubatan dan membentukkan banyak pengetahuan kita ketahu sekarang.
mt: The military nature of the Roman Empire helped in the development of medical progress. Doctors were recruited by Emperor Augustus and also formed the first Roman Medical Corps used to treat battlefield casualties. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from poppy seed and scopolamine from henbane. They became skilled in amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as suturing and ligating arteries to stem blood flow. For several centuries, the Roman Empire brought great advances in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Penglihatan, atau kebolehan melihat bergantung pada sistem visual organ sensor atau mata. Terdapat banyak pelbagai pandangan pembinaan, kejulatan dari kerumitan bergantung kepada syarat-syarat dari organisma. Pembinaan yang berbeza mempunyai keupayaan yang berbeza, adalah sensitif kepada perbezaan gelombang yang panjang dan mempunyai darjah ketajaman berbeza, juga mereka memerlukan pemprosesan yang berbeza untuk memahami input dan nombor yang berbeza untuk bekerja secara optimum.
mt: Vision, or the ability to see, depends on the visual sensory system or eyes. There are many different visual constructions, acuity from complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. Different constructions have different abilities, are sensitive to differences in the length of waves and have different degrees of sharpness, as well as they require different processing to understand the input and different numbers to work optimally.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: Sikhisme adalah agama daripada benua kecil India. Ia berasal daripada kawasan Punjab dalam abad ke15 dari perpecahan mazhab di dalam tradisi Hindu. Sikh menganggap kepercayaan mereka sebagai agama yang berasingan daripada agama Hindu walaupun mereka mengakui akar dan tradisi Hindu. Orang Sikh menggelar agama mereka Gurmat, iaitu “cara seorang guru” dalam bahasa Pujab. Guru ialah aspek asas untuk semua agama India tetapi agama Sikh telah mengambil kepentingan yang menjadi teras kepercayaan Sikh. Agama ini diasaskan oleh Guru Nanak pada abad ke-15 (1469-1539). Kemudian diikuti sembilan guru berturut-turut.
mt: Sikhism is a religion from the small continent of India. It originated from the Punjab region in the 15th century from a schism within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs regard their faith as a separate religion from Hinduism although they acknowledge its roots and Hindu tradition. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, i.e. "the way of the guru" in Punjabi. Guru is a central aspect for all Indian religions but Sikhism has taken the importance of the guru as its central tenet. The religion was founded by Guru Nanak in the 15th century (1469-1539). It was followed by nine successive gurus.
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: Gangguan defisit perhatian “adalah sindrom neurologi yang klasik menunjukkan triad gejala yang merangkumi impulsif, mudah teralih perhatian, dan hiperaktif atau bertenaga lebihan”. Ia bukan merupakan kecacatan pembelajaran, ia merupakan gangguan pembelajaran; ia mempengaruhi 3 hingga 5 peratus daripada semua kanak-kanak, mungkin sebanyak 2 juta kanak-kanak Amerika. Kanak-kanak dengan ADD sukar untuk memberi tumpuan kepada perkara seperti kerja sekolah. Namun mereka boleh menumpukan perhatian kepada perkara yang mereka gemari seperti bermain permainan atau menonton kartun kegemaran mereka atau menulis ayat-ayat tanpa tanda baca. Kanak-kanak ini cenderung untuk menghadapi masalah yang banyak, kerana mereka terlibat dalam tingkah laku yang berisiko, mudah bergaduh, dan mencabar pihak berkuasa “untuk merangsang otak mereka, kerana otak mereka tidak boleh dirangsang melalui kaedah normal”. ADD mempengaruhi hubungan dengan rakan sebaya yang lain kerana kanak-kanak lain tidak memahami mengapa mereka berkelakuan seadanya atau kelainan cara mereka mengeja atau perbezaan tahap kematangan mereka.
mt: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a neurobiological disorder that is characterized by a triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excessive energy. It is not a learning disability, it is a disorder of learning; it affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, possibly as many as 2 million children in the United States. Children with ADHD have difficulty focusing their attention on tasks such as schoolwork. However, they can focus their attention on things they enjoy such as playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to have many problems, because they are involved in risky behavior, prone to fighting, and challenging authority “to stimulate their brains, because their brains cannot be stimulated through normal means”. ADHD affects relationships with peers because other children do not understand why they behave as they do or differences in their spelling or differences in their level of maturity.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Walaupun pembelajaran berlandaskan projek seharusnya membuatkan proses pembelajaran lebih mudah dan menarik, perancah memberikan lebih daripada itu. Perancah bukan satu cara untuk pembelajaran tetapi lebih tepat satu bantuan iaitu memberi sokongan pada individu menjalani pengalaman pembelajaran baru seperti menggunakan program baru komputer atau permulaan projek baharu. Perancah boleh jadi samada maya atau nyata, dalam erti kata lain, seorang cikgu adalah sejenis perancah dan begitu juga lelaki klip kertas kecil dalam Microsoft Office. Perancah Maya diintergrasi ke dalam perisian dan bertindak untuk menyoal, membantu, dan menjelaskan prosedur yang mungkin sukar ditangani pelajar itu sendiri.
mt: Although project-based learning should make the learning process easier and more engaging, scaffolding provides more than that. Scaffolding is not a way of learning but rather a support, providing support to individuals in experiencing new learning experiences such as using new computer programs or starting new projects. Scaffolding can be either virtual or real, in other words, a teacher is a kind of scaffolding and so is the little man in the Microsoft Office clip. Virtual scaffolding is integrated into software and acts to ask, help, and explain procedures that may be difficult for the student to handle on his own.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace adalah laman web ketiga paling popular yang digunakan di Amerika Syarikat dan terdapat 54 juta profail pada masa ini. Laman sesawang ini mendapat banyak perhatian, terutama daripada penetap pendidikan. Terdapat aspek positif kepada laman web ini, termasuk, dapat mengatur halaman kelas dengan mudah yang boleh merangkumi blog-blog, video-video, gambar-gambar dan ciri-ciri lain. Halaman ini dapat diakses dengan mudah dengan memberikan hanya satu alamat web, yang membuatkannya mudah untuk diingat dan senang ditaip oleh pelajar yang mungkin menghadapi masalah dengan papan kunci atau ejaan. Ia boleh disesuaikan untuk membuat ia mudah untuk membaca dan juga dengan warna yang banyak atau sedikit seperti yang dikehendaki.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and there are 54 million profiles at this time. This website has received a lot of attention, especially from education researchers. There are positive aspects to this website, including, it can easily arrange a classroom page that can include blogs, videos, pictures and other features. This page can be easily accessed by simply giving only one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type by students who may have difficulty with the keyboard or spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with many or few colors as desired.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: Namun begitu, pada bulan Jun 1956, janji-janji Krushchev dicabar ketika rusuhan di Poland yang menyebabkan kaum buruh menunjuk perasaan untuk membantah kekurangan makanan dan pemotongan gaji, yang bertukar kepada bantahan umum terhadap Komunisme. Walaupun pada akhirnya, Krushchev menghantar kereta kebal untuk memulihkan ketenteraman, beliau bersetuju kepada beberapa tuntutan ekonomi dan untuk melantik Wladyslaw Gomulka yang popular sebagai perdana menteri baru.
mt: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were challenged when riots in Poland caused workers to protest against food shortages and wage cuts, which turned into general opposition to Communism. Although eventually, Krushchev sent tanks to restore order, he agreed to some economic demands and appointed the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Jerman merupakan musuh bersama sewaktu Perang Dunia 2 yang menyebabkan kerjasama antara KRSS dan AS. Dengan akhirnya perang tersebut, pertembungan sistem, proses dan budaya telah menyebabkan negara-negara tersebut berbalah. Dua tahun selepas tamat peperangan, bekas pihak perikatan sekarang menjadi musuh dan Perang Dingin bermula. Ia akan berlangsung selama 40 tahun seterusnya dan akan diperjuangkan secara nyata oleh tentera proksi di medan perang dari Afrika hingga Asia, di Afghanistan, Cuba dan banyak tempat yang lain.
mt: Germany was a common enemy during World War 2 that caused the cooperation between the USSR and the US. With the end of the war, the clash of systems, processes and cultures caused the two countries to argue. Two years after the end of the war, former allies are now enemies and the Cold War begins. It will last for 40 years to come and will be fought in earnest by proxy armies in the battlefield from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Sistem Saraf mengekalkan homeostasis dengan menghantar impuls saraf ke seluruh badan untuk memastikan pengaliran darah yang tidak terganggu. Impuls saraf ini dapat dihantar dengan begitu cepat ke seluruh badan yang membantu melindungi badan daripada sebarang kemungkinan ancaman.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses throughout the body to ensure unimpeded blood flow. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body that it helps protect the body from any possible threat.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: Piramid hebat di Giza adalah satu daripada tujuh keajabian dunia yang masih tegak hari ini. Dibina oleh orang Mesir pada abad ketiga sebelum Masihi, Piramid Agung merupakan salah satu daripada banyak struktur piramid yang dibina untuk mengingati Firaun yang meninggal. Di Dataran Tinggi Giza, atau “Nekropolis Giza” di Lembah Orang Mati Mesir terdapat beberapa piramid (antaranya piramid yang terbesar), beberapa makam kecil, beberapa kuil, dan Sphinx yang hebat. Piramid besar dicipta untuk menghormati Firaun Khufu, dan banyak piramid, makam, dan kuil yang lebih kecil dibangunkan untuk menghormati isteri dan anggota keluarga Khufu.
mt: The Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the seven wonders of the world still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century before Christ, the Great Pyramid is one of many pyramid structures built to remember Pharaohs who died. On the Giza Plateau, or the “Necropolis Giza” in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead, there are several pyramids (including the largest pyramid), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The large pyramid was created to honor Pharaoh Khufu, and many pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu’s wife and other family members.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Kuil Artemis di Ephesus telah dimusnahkan pada 21 Julai, 356 SM akibat daripada Herostratus yang telah membakarnya dengan sengaja. Menurut cerita berkenaan, motivasinya adalah segalanya kemasyhuran. Pihak Ephesian dalam marahnya mengumumkan bahwa nama Herostratus tidak pernah direkod. Ahli sejarah Greek Strabo kemudian menyatakan nama itu, sepertimana kita tahu pada hari ini. Kuil tersebut telah dimusnahkan pada malam yang sama ketika Alexander Agung dilahirkan. Alexander, sebagai raja, menawarkan untuk menampung kos pembinaan semula kuil, namun tawaran beliau ditolak. Kemudian, selepas Alexander wafat, kuil tersebut dibina semula pada 323 SM.
mt: The Temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BC by Herostratus, who had burned it deliberately. According to the story, his motive was simply fame. The Ephesians in their anger announced that the name of Herostratus would never be recorded. Greek historian Strabo later named him, as we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay for the rebuilding of the temple, but his offer was refused. Later, after Alexander's death, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BC.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Pengangkutan pertama yang diketahui adalah berjalan kaki, manusia mula berjalan secara menegak dua juta tahun yang lalu dengan kemunculan Homo Erectus (yang bermaksud lelaki tegak). Pengawas mereka, para Australopithecus tidak berjalan tegak secara kebiasaan. Pengkhususan bipedal didapati dalam fosil Australopithecus dari 4.2-3.9 juta tahun dahulu, walaupun Sahelanthropus mungkin berjalan dengan dua kaki seawal tujuh juta tahun yang lalu.
mt: The first known mode of transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the appearance of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their supervisors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright normally. Bipedal specialization was found in the fossils of Australopithecus from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Menggunakan kapal untuk mengangkut barang adalah kaedah yang paling berkesan untuk menggerak amaun yang besar manusia dan barang merentasi lautan. Secara tradisinya, tugas angkatan laut adalah memastikan negara anda mengekalkan kebolehannya untuk memindahkan masyarakat dan barangan, sambil mengganggu kemampuan musuh anda memindahkan masyarakat dan barangan mereka. Salah satu contoh terbaharu yang paling terkenal berkenaan ini ialah kempen WWII Atlantik Utara. Orang Amerika mencuba untuk menggerakkan orang dan bahan-bahan melintasi Lautan Atlantik untuk membantu Britain. Pada masa yang sama, tentera laut Jerman, yang menggunakan U-bot sedang cuba untuk mengberhentikan lalulintas. Sekiranya pihak Perikatan telah gagal, Jerman mungkin dapat menakluk Britain sama seperti bahagian Eropah yang lain.
mt: Using ships to transport goods is the most effective way to move large amounts of people and goods across the seas. Traditionally, the navy's job is to ensure your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while disrupting your enemy's ability to move their people and goods. One of the most recent examples of this is the WWII Atlantic campaign. The Americans were trying to move people and goods across the Atlantic to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using U-boats, were trying to stop the traffic. If the Allies had failed, Germany might have been able to conquer Britain just like the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Penemuan roda berjejari menjadikan kereta perang Asyur lebih ringan, lebih cepat, dan lebih bersedia untuk mengejar askar dan kereta perang lain. Anak panah dari busur berbahaya mereka dapat menembusi perisai tentera pihak lawan. Kira-kira 1000 SM, Assyria memperkenalkan tentera berkuda pertama. Pasukan berkuda merupakan angkatan tentera yang bertempur sambil menunggang kuda. Pelana pada waktu itu masih belum dicipta, oleh itu pasukan berkuda Assyria bertempur tanpa menggunakan pelana.
mt: 1000 BC, Assyria introduced the first cavalry. Cavalry is an army that fights while riding horses. At that time, saddles had not yet been invented, so Assyrian cavalry fought without saddles.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Orang Babylon telah membina kuil primer untuk setiap dewa mereka yang dianggap sebagai rumah dewa tersebut. Orang ramai akan membawa korban kepada tuhan-tuhan dan paderi akan cuba memenuhi keperluan tuhan-tuhan melalui pelbagai upacara dan perayaan. Setiap kuil mempunyai halaman kuil yang terbuka dan tempat suci dalaman yang hanya dibenarkan kepada paderi. Kadang-kadang menara istimewa berbentuk piramid yang dipanggil zigurat, dibina untuk menjadi sebahagian daripada kuil-kuil tersebut. Puncak menara tersebut menjadi kawasan perlindungan bagi dewa tersebut.
mt: The Babylonians built a primary temple for each of their gods, which was considered the god's home. The public would bring sacrifices to the gods and priests would try to meet the gods' needs through various rituals and celebrations. Each temple had an open courtyard and an inner sanctuary that was only allowed to priests. Sometimes special towers in the shape of pyramids called ziggurats were built as part of these temples. The tops of these towers were a protected area for the gods.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: Ya! Raja Tutankhamun, kadangkala digelar “Raja Tut” atau “Raja Kanak-kanak”, merupakan salah satu raja Mesir kuno yang paling terkenal pada zaman moden. Menariknya, beliau tidak dianggap sangat penting pada zaman kuno dan tidak disenaraikan dalam kebanyakan senarai raja zaman kuno. Namun begitu, penemuan kuburnya pada tahun 1922 membuatkannya menjadi selebriti. Sementara banyak kubur zaman dulu dirompak, kubur ini tidak diganggu. Sebilangan besar barang yang ditanam bersama Tutankhamun telah dipelihara dengan baik, termasuk ribuan artifak yang diperbuat daripada logam berharga dan batu nadir.
mt: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes called "King Tut" or "Boy King", is one of the most famous ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered very important in ancient times and was not listed in most ancient king lists. However, his discovery in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many ancient tombs were looted, this one was undisturbed. Many of the objects buried with Tutankhamun were well preserved, including thousands of artifacts made of precious metals and rare stones.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Kita mengenali ramai ahli politik, saintis, dan seniman Yunani. Tetapi tokoh yang mungkin paling terkenal dari budaya ini ialah Homer, penyair buta legenda yang mengarang dua karya sastera Yunani: puisi Iliad dan Odyssey. Sophocles dan Aristophanes masih merupakan penulis drama yang terkenal dan drama mereka dianggap antara karya yang terbaik di dunia sastera. Seorang lagi orang Yunani yang terkenal merupakan ahli matematik Pythagoras, yang paling terkenal untuk teorem terkenalnya tentang hubungan antara sisi-sisi segi tiga tepat.
mt: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. But the most famous figure from this culture may be Homer, the blind legendary poet who wrote two Greek epics: the Iliad and the Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still well-known playwrights, and their plays are considered among the best in the world of literature. Another famous Greek was the mathematician Pythagoras, most famous for his famous theorem about the relationship between the sides of a right triangle.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: Dalam iklim yang panas di Timur Tengah, rumah itu tidak lagi begitu penting. Sebahagian besar kehidupan keluarga Ibrani berlaku dalam persekitaran terbuka. Wanita memasak di halaman; kedai hanya merupakan kaunter terbuka yang menghadap jalan. Batu telah digunakan untuk membina rumah. Tidak terdapat hutan besar di tanah Canaan, oleh itu kayu adalah sumber yang sangat mahal.
mt: In the hot climate of the Middle East, the house was no longer so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family took place in an open environment. Women cooked in the yard; shops were only open counters facing the street. Stone was used to build houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was a very expensive source.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: Greenland berpenduduk jarang. Menurut saga Norse, Erik the Red dibuang dari Iceland kerana membunuh, dan semasa dalam perjalanan ke barat, menemui Greenland dan menamakannya Greenland. Namun tanpa mengendahkan penemuannya, suku Eskimo sudah menetap di sana pada ketika itu. Walaupun setiap negara merupakan 'Scandinavia', terdapat banyak perbezaan rakyat, raja, budaya dan sejarah antara Denmark, Sweden, Norway dan Iceland.
mt: Greenland is sparsely populated. According to Norse saga, Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and while on his way west, he discovered Greenland and named it Greenland. However, without acknowledging his discovery, the Eskimo people had already settled there at the time. Although each country is 'Scandinavia', there are many differences between the people, king, culture and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Greenland berpenduduk jarang. Menurut saga Norse, Erik the Red dibuang dari Iceland kerana membunuh, dan semasa dalam perjalanan ke barat, menemui Greenland dan menamakannya Greenland. Namun tanpa mengendahkan penemuannya, suku Eskimo sudah menetap di sana pada ketika itu. Walaupun setiap negara merupakan 'Scandinavia', terdapat banyak perbezaan rakyat, raja, budaya dan sejarah antara Denmark, Sweden, Norway dan Iceland.
