Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Walaupun kebanyakan daripada makanan mereka akan kita kenali, orang Roman juga mempunyai makanan kenduri yang pelik atau aneh, termasuk babi hutan, burung merak, siput, dan sejenis tikus yang dipanggil dormouse. Satu lagi perbezaan adalah sementara orang-orang miskin dan wanita yang makan makanan mereka sambil duduk di kerusi, orang-orang kaya suka membuat jamuan bersama-sama di mana mereka akan bersantai di sisi mereka ketika mereka makan makanan mereka. Sajian Rom kuno tidak mungkin merangkumi makanan yang dibawa ke Eropah dari Amerika atau Asia pada abad-abad kemudian. Sebagai contoh, mereka tidak mempunyai jagung, atau tomato, atau ubi kentang, atau koko, dan tiada orang Rom kuno pernah merasai seekor ayam belanda.
mt: While most of their food will be familiar, the Romans also had strange or odd wedding feasts, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a kind of mouse called a dormouse. Another difference is while the poor and women ate their food while sitting on chairs, the rich liked to have banquets together where they would recline on their sides while eating their food. A Roman feast would not have included food brought to Europe from the Americas or Asia in later centuries. For example, they did not have corn, or tomatoes, or potatoes, or coffee, and no Roman ever tasted a turkey.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Sebuah tamadun ialah budaya tunggal yang dikongsi oleh sekumpulan besar orang yang hidup dan bekerja secara bersepadu, sebuah masyarakat. Perkataan tamadun berasal dari civilis Latin, bermakna awam, yang berkaitan dengan Civis Latin, bermakna warganegara, dan civitas yang bermaksud bandar atau bandar raya, dan itu juga bagaimanapun mentakrifkan saiz masyarakat. Negeri-bandar ialah permulaan sebuah negara. Budaya tamadun menandakan penyebaran pengetahuan dari generasi ke generasi, jejak budaya yang sentiasa wujud dan penyebaran yang adil. Budaya kecil selalunya hilang tanpa meninggalkan bukti sejarah yang relevan dan gagal untuk diiktiraf sebagai peradaban yang sempurna.
mt: A civilization is a single culture shared by a large group of people living and working together, a society. The word civilization is derived from civilis Latin, meaning public, related to Civis Latin, meaning citizen, and civitas which means city or city, and it also however defines the size of a society. The city-state is the beginning of a country. The culture of civilization indicates the spread of knowledge from generation to generation, the cultural track that always exists and the spread of justice. Small cultures usually disappear without leaving relevant historical evidence and fail to be recognized as a perfect civilization.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong merupakan sebuah kubu yang musnah dan biara Buddha di bahagian atas dari Daerah Paro (dalam Kampung Phondey). Dikatakan bahawa pada tahun 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel telah membina kubu tersebut untuk memperingati kemenangannya menentang angkatan Tibet-Mongol. Pada tahun 1951, sebuah kebakaran menyebabkan hanya beberapa peninggalan Drukgyal Dzong tertinggal, seperti imej Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Selepas kebakaran, kubu itu dipelihara dan dilindungi, dan kekal sebagai salah satu tarikan paling sensasi di Bhutan.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro valley (in Phondey village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal built the fortress to commemorate his victory over the Tibet-Mongol army. In 1951, a fire left only a few remnants of Drukgyal Dzong, such as an image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, and remains as one of the most popular attractions in Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Dalam abad ke-18, Kemboja mendapat dirinya terhimpit antara dua jiran yang kuat, Negeri Thai dan Vietnam. Orang Thai menyerbu Kemboja beberapa kali pada abad ke-18 dan telah memusnahkan Phnom Penh pada tahun 1772. Dalam tahun-tahun terakhir abad ke-18, Vietnam juga telah menjajah Kemboja.
mt: 18th century, Cambodia found itself caught between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and had destroyed Phnom Penh in 1772. In the last years of the 18th century, Vietnam also had conquered Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Dalam abad ke-18, Kemboja mendapat dirinya terhimpit antara dua jiran yang kuat, Negeri Thai dan Vietnam. Orang Thai menyerbu Kemboja beberapa kali pada abad ke-18 dan telah memusnahkan Phnom Penh pada tahun 1772. Dalam tahun-tahun terakhir abad ke-18, Vietnam juga telah menjajah Kemboja.

src: Seawal abad ke-15 lagi Taiwan mula dilihat dan direkodkan oleh pedagang-pedagang Eropah yang menggelarkan pulau tersebut sebagai IIha Formosa, atau pulau yang cantik. Dalam 1624, Syarikat India Timur Belanda menubuhkan pangkalan di barat daya Taiwan, mewujudkan transformasi pada amalan pengeluaran biji-bijian orang asli dan menggaji buruh Cina untuk bekerja di ladang padi dan gula. Pada 1683, pasukan dinasti Qing (1644-1912) menguasai kawasan pesisir barat dan utara Taiwan dan mengisytiharkan Taiwan sebagai wilayah Empayar Qing pada 1885. Pada 1895, selepas kekalahan dalam Perang China-Jepun (1894-1895), Kerajaan Qing menandatangani Perjanjian Shimonoseki, di mana ia menyerahkan kuasa ke atas Taiwan kepada Jepun, yang memerintah pulau itu sehingga tahun 1945.
mt: Taiwan has been seen and recorded by European traders since the 15th century, who called the island Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base on the southwest coast of Taiwan, transforming the aboriginal grain-growing practices and hiring Chinese laborers to work in rice and sugar fields. In 1683, Qing dynasty troops took control of the west and north coast of Taiwan and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, in which it ceded control of Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Ini dipanggil pH kimia. Anda boleh menghasilkan penanda menggunakan jus kubis merah. Jus kubis akan bertukar warna bergantung pada betapa berasid atau berbes (beralkali) sesuatu bahan kimia itu. Tahap pH ditunjukkan oleh jumlah ion Hidrogen (huruf H dalam pH) dalam bahan kimia yang diuji. Ion hidrogen ialah proton dengan elektron yang dialih keluar (kerana atom Hidrogen terdiri daripada satu proton dan satu elektron).
mt: This is called chemical pH. You can make a pH indicator using red cabbage juice. Red cabbage juice will change color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) a chemical is. The pH level is shown by the amount of Hydrogen ions (H letter in pH) in the chemical being tested. Hydrogen ions are protons with an electron removed (because Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Singa adalah kucing yang paling sosial, dan hidup dalam kumpulan besar yang digelar “sekawan singa”. Sekumpulan singa dibentuk daripada seekor hingga tiga ekor jantan dewasa, bersama sebanyak tiga puluh ekor betina dan anak-anaknya. Kaum wanita selalunya rapat antara satu sama lain, kerana terdiri daripada keluarga besar saudara perempuan serta anak perempuan. Prides Lion bertindak sama seperti sekumpulan serigala atau anjing, haiwan yang memeranjatkan sama dengan tingkah laku singa (tetapi bukan kucing besar) dan juga sangat berbahaya kepada mangsanya.
mt: Lions are the most social of cats, and live in large groups called "prides". A pride is formed of one to three adult males, together with up to thirty females and their cubs. The females are usually close to one another, as they are made up of a large family of sisters and daughters. Prides of lions behave like packs of wolves or dogs, animals that resemble the behavior of lions (but not big cats) and are also very dangerous to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Di bawah mereka lebih banyak kucing-kucing saiz sederhana yang makan mangsa saiz medium daripada arnab hingga kijang dan kancil. Akhir sekali, terdapat banyak kucing bersaiz kecil (termasuk kucing liar) yang memakan lebih banyak mangsa kecil seperti serangga, tikus, cicak dan burung. Rahsia kejayaan mereka adalah konsep niche, tugas khas bagi setiap kucing yang mencegahnya daripada bersaing dengan kucing yang lain.
mt: Underneath them are more medium-sized cats that eat medium-sized prey from rabbits to deer and antelope. Finally, there are many small cats (including wildcats) that eat smaller prey such as insects, mice, lizards and birds. Their secret to success is the niche concept, a special task for each cat that prevents them from competing with other cats.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Harimau oselot gemar memakan haiwan kecil. Ia akan menangkap monyet, ular, tikus dan burung jika boleh. Hampir semua haiwan yang diburunya jauh lebih kecil daripada saiznya. Para saintis berpendapat bahawa harimau oselot mengekori dan mencari haiwan untuk dimakan (Mangsa) melalui deria bau iaitu menghidu tanah yang pernah dilaluinya. Ocelot boleh melihat dengan baik menggunakan penglihatan malam, dan juga bergerak dengan perlahan-lahan. Ocelot memburu mangsanya dengan bersembunyi dalam persekitaran yang menyerupai warna badannya dan kemudian menerkam mangsanya.
mt: Ocelots prefer to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rats and birds if they can. Almost all the animals they hunt are smaller than they are. Scientists believe that ocelots follow and search for animals to eat (prey) through the sense of smell, that is, by smelling the ground that they have passed. Ocelots can see well using night vision, and also move slowly. Ocelots hunt their prey by hiding in an environment that resembles their color and then pounce on their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Harimau oselot gemar memakan haiwan kecil. Ia akan menangkap monyet, ular, tikus dan burung jika boleh. Hampir semua haiwan yang diburunya jauh lebih kecil daripada saiznya. Para saintis berpendapat bahawa harimau oselot mengekori dan mencari haiwan untuk dimakan (Mangsa) melalui deria bau iaitu menghidu tanah yang pernah dilaluinya. Ocelot boleh melihat dengan baik menggunakan penglihatan malam, dan juga bergerak dengan perlahan-lahan. Ocelot memburu mangsanya dengan bersembunyi dalam persekitaran yang menyerupai warna badannya dan kemudian menerkam mangsanya.
mt: Ocelots prefer to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rats and birds if they can. Almost all the animals they hunt are smaller than they are. Scientists believe that ocelots follow and search for animals to eat (prey) through the sense of smell, that is, by smelling the ground that they have passed. Ocelots can see well using night vision, and also move slowly. Ocelots hunt their prey by hiding in an environment that resembles their color and then pounce on their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Bersedia untuk menyerang, harimau boleh memanjat (walaupun tidak begitu bagus), berenang, melompat jarak jauh dan menarik dengan kekuatan lima kali ganda daripada manusia yang kuat. Harimau adalah dalam kumpulan yang sama (Genus Panthera) seperti singa, harimau bintang, dan jaguar. Hanya empat jenis kucing ini boleh mengaum. Ngauman harimau bukan seperti raungan suara penuh singa, lebih kepada ayat kata-kata kusut, jeritan kata-kata.
mt: Ready to attack, a tiger can climb (although not so well), swim, jump long distances and pull with five times the strength of a strong human. Tigers are in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. Only four of these cats can roar. A tiger's roar is not like a full-throated lion's roar, more like a garbled phrase, a phrase, a phrase.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Sel ialah unit terkecil berstruktur dan berfungsi dari organisma hidup. Sel berasal daripada perkataan Latin “cella” yang bermaksud bilik kecil. Jika anda melihat organisma hidup di bawah mikroskop, anda akan melihat bahawa ia terdiri daripada petak atau bola kecil-kecilan. Robert Hooke, ahli biologi dari England, nampak petak kecil dalam penyumbat melalui mikroskop. Ia kelihatan seperti bilik-bilik. Beliau orang pertama untuk memerhatikan sel-sel mati
mt: Cells are the smallest structural and functional units of living organisms. The word cell comes from the Latin word "cella" meaning small room. If you look at living organisms under a microscope, you will see that they are made up of small boxes or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small boxes in the pores through a microscope. It looked like rooms. He was the first to observe dead cells
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Haiwan dijadikan dari banyak sel. Haiwan makan benda dan menghadamkannya di dalam. Kebanyakan haiwan boleh bergerak. Hanya binatang mempunyai otak (walaupun tidak pada semua binatang ada; ubur-ubur contohnya, tidak mempunyai otak). Haiwan ditemukan di seluruh dunia. Mereka menggali tanah, berenang dalam laut dan terbang di langit.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. Animals eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (although not all animals have them; worms, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the world. They dig in the ground, swim in the sea and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Tumbuhan menghasilkan oksigen yang disedut oleh manusia dan mengambil karbon dioksida yang dihembuskan oleh manusia (ketika bernafas). Tumbuhan menghasilkan makanan daripada cahaya matahari melalui fotosintesis. Ia juga memberi teduh. Kita membina rumah kami daripada tumbuh-tumbuhan dan membuat pakaian daripada tumbuh-tumbuhan. Kebanyakan makanan yang kita makan merupakan tumbuh-tumbuhan. Tanpa tumbuh-tumbuhan, haiwan tidak boleh hidup.
mt: Plants produce oxygen that is breathed by humans and take in carbon dioxide that is exhaled by humans (when breathing). Plants produce food from sunlight through photosynthesis. It also provides shade. We build our homes from plants and make clothing from plants. Most of the food we eat is plants. Without plants, animals cannot live.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Apabila kumpulan kecil makhluk hidup (populasi kecil) terpisah dari populasi utama dari mana mereka berasal (contohnya jika mereka mengembara ke seberang pegunungan atau sungai, atau jika mereka berpindah ke pulau baru sehingga mereka tidak dapat berpindah semula dengan mudah) mereka sering berakhir dalam persekitaran yang berbeza daripada sebelumnya. Persekitaran baru ini terdapat sumber pelbagai dan persaing yang berbeza, oleh itu populasi baru akan memerlukan ciri-ciri berbeza atau adaptasi untuk menjadi persaing yang kuat daripada apa yang mereka perlu sebelum ini. Penduduk asal tidak berubah sama sekali, mereka masih memerlukan penyesuaian sama seperti sebelum. Dari masa ke masa, sebagai penduduk baru yang bermula untuk menyesuaikan diri dengan persekitaran yang baru, mereka mula kelihatan kurang dan kurang seperti penduduk lain. Pakhirnya, selepas beribu-ribu atau berjuta-juta tahun, kedua populasi akan kelihatan sangat berbeza sehingga mereka tidak lagi daripada spesies yang sama. Kami menggelar proses ini pengspesiesan, yang bermaksud pembentukan spesies baru. Pengspesiesan merupakan kesan yang tidak dapat dielakkan dan bahagian penting evolusi.
mt: When a small group of living things (a small population) is separated from the main population from which they originated (for example, if they travel across mountains or rivers, or if they move to a new island so that they cannot easily return) they often end up in a different environment than before. The new environment has different resources and different competition, so the new population will need different traits or adaptations to be a strong competitor from what they needed before. The original inhabitants do not change at all, they still need the same adjustments as before. Over time, as the new inhabitants begin to adjust to the new environment, they begin to look less and less like the other inhabitants. Eventually, after thousands or millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they are no longer of the same species. We call this process speciation, which means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Organ utama dalam sistem peredaran darah ialah jantung yang mengepam darah. Darah mengalir daripada jantung dalam saluran yang digelar arteri dan kembali ke jantung dalam saluran yang digelar vena. Saluran yang paling kecil ialah kapilari.
mt: The main organ in the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood flows from the heart in vessels called arteries and back to the heart in vessels called veins. The smallest vessels are capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Organ utama dalam sistem peredaran darah ialah jantung yang mengepam darah. Darah mengalir daripada jantung dalam saluran yang digelar arteri dan kembali ke jantung dalam saluran yang digelar vena. Saluran yang paling kecil ialah kapilari.
mt: The main organ in the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood flows from the heart in vessels called arteries and back to the heart in vessels called veins. The smallest vessels are capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Serangga adalah haiwan pertama dibawa ke udara. Keupayaan mereka untuk terbang membantu mereka mengelak musuh dengan mudah dan mencari makanan dan rakan dengan lebih cekap. Kebanyakan serangga mempunyai kelebihan untuk melipat sayap kembali ke sisi badan. Ini memberi mereka kawasan yang luas tempat-tempat yang kecil untuk bersembunyi dari pemangsa. Kini, satu-satunya serangga yang tidak boleh melipat sayapnya adalah pepatung dan lalat mayfly.
mt: Insects were the first animals to fly. Their ability to fly helps them avoid enemies easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have an advantage to fold their wings back against their body. This gives them a large area of small places to hide from predators. Now, the only insect that cannot fold its wings is the mayfly and the moth.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Ramai ahli paleontologi pada hari ini percaya bahawa satu kumpulan dinosaur terselamat dan masih hidup. Kami memanggilnya burung. Ramai orang tidak beranggapan ia merupakan dinosaur disebabkan ia mempunyai bulu pelepah dan boleh terbang. Namun terdapat banyak perkara berkenaan burung yang masih menyerupai dinosaur. Ia mempunyai kaki bersisik dan berkuku, bertelur, dan berjalan di atas dua kaki belakang seperti T-Rex.
mt: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is still alive. We call them birds. Many people do not consider them to be dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. However, there are many things about birds that still resemble dinosaurs. They have scaly feet and claws, lay eggs, and walk on two hind legs like the T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Gigi triceratop bukan sahaja mampu menghancurkan daunan tetapi juga dahan dan akar pokok yang keras. Beberapa saintis berfikir bahawa Triceratops telah memakan cycad, yang merupakan sejenis tumbuhan yang biasa ditemui pada zaman Cretaceous. Tumbuh-tumbuhan ini kelihatan seperti pohon palma kecil dengan mahkota yang terdiri daripada daun tajam berpacak. Triceratops mungkin menggunakan paruhnya yang kuat untuk mencarik daun sebelum memakan batang pokok. Para saintis lain berpendapat bahawa tumbuhan ini sangat beracun jadi ia tidak mungkin mana-mana dinosaur makan mereka, walaupun hari ini sloth dan haiwan lain suka burung kakak tua (keturunan dinosaur) boleh makan daun beracun atau buah-buahan.
mt: Triceratops teeth were not only able to crush leaves but also branches and roots of hard trees. Some scientists think that Triceratops ate cycad, a type of plant that was common during the Cretaceous. These plants looked like small palm trees with crowns consisting of pointed, packed leaves. Triceratops may have used its strong beak to tear leaves before eating the tree trunk. Other scientists think that these plants were very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, although today sloths and other animals like the kakatoa (a dinosaur descendant) can eat poisonous leaves or fruits.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Bola sepak kebangsaan Itali, bersama-sama dengan pasukan bola sepak German merupakan pasukan kedua paling berjaya di dunia dan merupakan juara Piala Dunia FIFA pada tahun 2006. Sukan popular termasuk bola sepak, bola keranjang, bola tampar, polo air, lawan pedang, ragbi, berbasikal, hoki ais, hoki kasut roda dan perlumbaan motor F1. Sukan musim sejuk sangat popular di bahagian Utara, dengan orang Itali bertanding dalam permainan antarabangsa dan acara Olimpik.
mt: Italy's national football team, along with Germany's, is the second most successful in the world and was the FIFA World Cup champion in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, inline hockey and Formula One racing. Winter sports are very popular in the North, with Italians competing in international and Olympic events.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Bola sepak kebangsaan Itali, bersama-sama dengan pasukan bola sepak German merupakan pasukan kedua paling berjaya di dunia dan merupakan juara Piala Dunia FIFA pada tahun 2006. Sukan popular termasuk bola sepak, bola keranjang, bola tampar, polo air, lawan pedang, ragbi, berbasikal, hoki ais, hoki kasut roda dan perlumbaan motor F1. Sukan musim sejuk sangat popular di bahagian Utara, dengan orang Itali bertanding dalam permainan antarabangsa dan acara Olimpik.
mt: Italy's national football team, along with Germany's, is the second most successful in the world and was the FIFA World Cup champion in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, inline hockey and Formula One racing. Winter sports are very popular in the North, with Italians competing in international and Olympic events.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luxembourg mempunyai sejarah lama tetapi kemerdekaannya bertarikh dari 1839. Bahagian sekarang di Belgium adalah sebahagian Luxemboug di masa lalu tetapi menjadi Belgian selepas Revolusi Belgian 1830. Luxembourg sentiasa berusaha untuk kekal sebagai negara neutral namun telah diduduki oleh pihak Jerman pada Perang Dunia I dan Perang Dunia II. Pada 1957, Luxembourg telah menjadi ahli pengasas organisasi yang kini dikenali sebagai Kesatuan Eropah.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. The part of Belgium now is part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the Belgian Revolution of 1830. Luxembourg has always strived to remain a neutral country but was occupied by the Germans during World War I and World War II. In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Turki Eropah (Thrace timur atau Rumelia di semenanjung Balkan) membentuk 3% dari negara tersebut. Wilayah Turki memiliki panjang lebih dari 1,600 kilometer (1,000 mi) dan lebar 800 km (500 mi), dengan secara kasar berbentuk segi empat. Kawasan Turki, termasuk tasik, menghuni 783,562 kilometer persegi (300,948 meter persegi), iaitu 755,688 kilometer persegi (291,773 meter persegi) berada di Asia barat daya dan 23,764 kilometer persegi (9,174 meter persegi) di Eropah. Keluasan Turki menjadikan ia negara ke-37 terbesar di dunia, dan saiznya umpama Metropolitan Perancis dan United Kingdom digabungkan. Turki dilingkari laut pada tiga sisi, Laut Aegean pada arah barat, Laut Hitam pada arah utara dan Laut Mediterania pada arah selatan.
mt: 3% of the country is in Europe (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula). The region of Turkey has a length of more than 1,600 kilometers (1,000 mi) and a width of 800 km (500 mi), roughly in the shape of a rectangle. The Turkish area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometers (300,948 square miles), of which 755,688 square kilometers (291,773 square miles) are in southwestern Asia and 23,764 square kilometers (9,174 square miles) in Europe. The size of Turkey makes it the 37th largest country in the world, and its size is similar to the combined Metropolitan France and United Kingdom. Turkey is surrounded by sea on three sides, the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Penduduk Vatican City adalah sekitar 800. Ia adalah negara bebas yang paling kecil di dunia dan negara dengan penduduk yang paling rendah. Bandar Vatican menggunakan bahasa Itali dalam undang-undang dan komunikasi rasmi. Bahasa Itali merupakan bahasa harian yang digunakan oleh kebanyakan darpada mereka yang bekerja di negeri itu manakala bahasa Latin biasanya digunakan dalam upacara keagamaan. Semua warganegara Bandar Vatican ialah Roman Katolik.
mt: The population of Vatican City is about 800. It is the smallest country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its laws and official communications. Italian is the everyday language used by most of the people who work in the country, while Latin is usually used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Hari ini komputer digunakan untuk manipulasi video-video dan foto-foto. Animasi sofistikated dapat dibina pada komputer, dan animasi seperti ini semakin kerap digunakan dalam televisyen dan filem. Muzik sering dirakam menggunakan komputer canggih untuk memproses dan campuran bunyi bersama-sama.
mt: Today computers are used to manipulate video and photographs. Sophisticated animations can be built on computers, and animations like this are increasingly used in television and movies. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Bandar Harappa dan Mohenjo-daro mempunyai tandas simbah di hampir setiap rumah yang dihubungkan kepada sistem kumbahan yang canggih. Sisa sistem kumbahan telah dijumpai di dalam rumah-rumah bandar Minoan iaitu Crete dan Santorini di Greece. Terdapat tandas juga di Mesir purba, Parsi dan China. Sewaktu tamadun Rom, tandas menjadi sebahagian daripada rumah mandi awam di mana lelaki dan perempuan bergaul bebas.
mt: Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had public toilets in almost every house connected to a sophisticated sewer system. Sewerage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan city of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. During the Roman era, toilets became part of public baths where men and women mingled freely.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Bilah skate ais moden mempunyai dua tepi berlengkung cengkung di antara mereka. Dua tepi berkenaan adalah untuk cengkaman ais yang lebih baik, walaupun ia dicondongkan. Oleh sebab bahagian bawah pisau sedikit melengkung, apabila pisau itu miring ke satu sisi ke sisi yang lain, tepi yang bersentuhan dengan ais juga melengkung. Ini menyebabkan pemain skate berpusing. Jika skate bercondong ke kanan, pemain skate berpusing ke kanan, jika skate bercondong ke kiri, pemain skate akan berpusing ke kiri.
mt: Modern ice skates have two curved edges between them. The two edges are for better ice grip, although it is bent. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, when the blade is tilted to one side to the other, the edge that is in contact with the ice is also curved. This causes the skater to spin. If the skate is tilted to the right, the skater will spin to the right, if the skate is tilted to the left, the skater will spin to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: Untuk kembali ke tahap tenaga sebelumnya, mereka perlu menyingkirkan lebihan tenaga yang mereka perolehi daripada cahaya. Mereka melakukan ini dengan mengeluarkan zarah kecil bercahaya yang digelar “foton”. Ahli saintis memanggil proses ini “pelepasan radiasi yang dirangsang” kerana atom-atom dirangsang oleh cahaya terang, menyebabkan pelepasan foton cahaya, dan cahaya adalah sejenis sinaran. Gambar seterusnya menunjukkan atom yang memancarkan foton. Dalam realiti foton ternyata jauh lebih kecil daripada yang ditunjukkan dalam gambar. Foton adalah lebih kecil lagi daripada unsur yang membentuk atom!
mt: To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the excess energy they gained from the light. They do this by emitting small light particles called “photons.” Scientists call this process “stimulated emission” because atoms are stimulated by bright light, causing the emission of photons of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows an atom emitting a photon. In reality, photons are much smaller than shown in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the particles that make up atoms!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Setelah ratusan jam operasi filamen dalam mentol akhirnya akan terbakar dan mentol tidak akan berfungsi lagi. Mentol tersebut kemudian perlu diganti. Adalah penting untuk berhati-hati ketika mengganti mentol tersebut. Pertama sekali, suis untuk lampu perlu dipadamkan atau kabel diputuskan. Ini adalah kerana elektrik mengalir ke dalam soket yang mana bahagian logam yang terdapat mentol boleh memberi anda renjatan elektrik yang serius jika anda menyentuh bahagian dalam soket atau pangkal logam mentol ketika sebahagiannya masih berada di dalam soket.
mt: After hundreds of hours of operation, the filament in the bulb will eventually burn out and the bulb will no longer work. The bulb will then need to be replaced. It is important to be careful when replacing the bulb. First, the light switch needs to be turned off or the power cord needs to be unplugged. This is because electricity is flowing into the socket where the metal part of the bulb can give you a serious electrical shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the base of the metal bulb while some of it is still in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Bom pembelahan berfungsi berdasarkan prinsip bahawa tenaga diperlukan untuk menggabungkan nukleus dengan proton dan neutron yang banyak. Seperti menarik pedati berat ke atas bukit. Memisahkan nukleus sekali lagi dan kemudian melepaskan sedikit tenaga tersebut. Atom tertentu mempunyai nukleus yang tidak stabil yang bermaksud ia boleh terpisah dengan sedikit atau tanpa sentuhan.
mt: The fission bomb works on the principle that energy is required to combine the nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Like pulling a heavy wagon up a hill. Separating the nucleus again and then releasing a little of that energy. Certain atoms have unstable nuclei which means they can be separated with little or no touching.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Apabila anda menghubungi seseorang yang jauh beribu-ribu batu, itu bermakna anda sedang menggunakan satelit. Satelit di angkasa mendapat panggilan dan memantul ia balik ke bawah, hampir serta-merta. Satelit itu dihantar ke angkasa lepas oleh roket. Saintis menggunakan teleskop di angkasa lepas kerana atmosfera Bumi mengganggu pencahayaan dan pandangan kita. Ia mengambil sebuah roket gergasi lebih 100 kaki tinggi untuk meletakkan satelit atau teleskop di angkasa.
mt: When you call someone thousands of miles away, that means you are using a satellite. Satellites in space get a call and bounce it back down, almost instantly. Satellites are sent into space by rockets. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere interferes with our light and vision. It takes a giant rocket over 100 feet tall to put a satellite or telescope in space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Masa adalah sesuatu yang di sekitar kita, ia memberi kesan kepada semua yang kita lakukan, namun ia sukar untuk difahami. Masa telah dikaji oleh cendekiawan agama, falsafah dan saintifik untuk ribuan tahun. Kita mengalami masa seperti satu siri peristiwa yang bergerak dari masa depan, ke masa kini, dan ke masa lampau. Masa juga merupakan cara kita membandingkan jangka masa (tempoh) acara. Anda sendiri boleh menandakan masa yang berlalu dengan memerhatikan pengulangan kejadian kitaran. Kejadian kitaran ialah sesuatu yang berlaku berulang-ulang kali secara regular.
mt: Time is something that surrounds us, it affects everything we do, yet it is hard to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events that move from the future, to the present, and to the past. Time is also a way we compare the duration of events. You can mark the passage of time by observing the recurrence of cyclic events. Cyclic events are things that happen over and over again in a regular manner.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Masa adalah sesuatu yang di sekitar kita, ia memberi kesan kepada semua yang kita lakukan, namun ia sukar untuk difahami. Masa telah dikaji oleh cendekiawan agama, falsafah dan saintifik untuk ribuan tahun. Kita mengalami masa seperti satu siri peristiwa yang bergerak dari masa depan, ke masa kini, dan ke masa lampau. Masa juga merupakan cara kita membandingkan jangka masa (tempoh) acara. Anda sendiri boleh menandakan masa yang berlalu dengan memerhatikan pengulangan kejadian kitaran. Kejadian kitaran ialah sesuatu yang berlaku berulang-ulang kali secara regular.
mt: Time is something that surrounds us, it affects everything we do, yet it is hard to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events that move from the future, to the present, and to the past. Time is also a way we compare the duration of events. You can mark the passage of time by observing the recurrence of cyclic events. Cyclic events are things that happen over and over again in a regular manner.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Secara tradisi, pewaris takhta akan terus menyertai tentera setelah tamat sekoloah. Walau bagaimanapun, Charles menghadiri universiti di Trinity College, Cambridge di mana beliau mempelajari Antropologi dan Arkeologi, dan kemudian Sejarah, memperoleh 2:2 (ijazah kelas kedua bawah). Charles ialah ahli pertama daripada Keluarga Diraja Britain yang dianugerahkan ijazah.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne will continue to serve in the military after leaving school. However, Charles attended university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and then History, receiving a 2:2 (second class lower degree). Charles is the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: England telah mengalami tempoh masa keamanan yang panjang selepas mengalahkan semula dari Danelaw. Namun pada 991, Ethelred telah berhadapan dengan armada Viking yang lebih besar daripada mana-mana yang lain sejak Guthrum satu abad sebelumnya. Armada ini dipimpin oleh Olaf Trygvasson, orang Norway dengan cita-cita untuk menuntut kembali negaranya daripada penguasaan Denmark. Selepas beberapa masalah ketenteraan, Ethelred telah bersetuju dengan terma-terma Olaf, yang telah kembali ke Norway dan mencuba untuk menuntut kerajaannya dengan kemenangan bercampur.
mt: England had experienced a long period of peace after defeating the Danelaw. However, in 991, Ethelred was faced with a larger Viking fleet than any since Guthrum a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish rule. After some military difficulties, Ethelred agreed to Olaf's terms, who returned to Norway and tried to reclaim his kingdom with mixed success.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: Sekitar abad ke-15, Estonia utara berada di bawah pengaruh kuat budaya German. Beberapa rahib Jerman ingin mendekatkan Tuhan kepada masyarakat setempat, lalu mereka mencipta bahasa harfiah Estonia. Ia berdasarkan abjad Jerman dan satu karakter “Õ/õ” yang ditambahkan. Seiring masa berlalu, banyak perkataan yang dipinjam dari bahasa Jerman disatukan. Ini adalah satu permulaan yang cerah.
mt: Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under strong German cultural influence. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the local population, so they created a literal Estonian language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character “Õ/õ” was added. Over time, many words borrowed from German were combined. This was a bright start.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Terdapat pelbagai anggaran tentang jumlah orang yang boleh bertutur dalam bahasa Hindi. Ia dianggarkan sebagai antara bahasa yang kedua dan keempat paling sering digunakan di dunia. Bilangan penutur asli berbeza bergantung sama ada atau tidak kaitan rapat loghat dikira. Jumlah anggaran ialah 340 juta hingga 500 juta penutur, dan sebanyak 800 juta orang dapat memahami bahasa ini. Bahasa Hindi dan Urdu adalah sama dari segi perbendaharaan kata, tetapi berbeza dari segi skrip; dalam perbualan harian, penutur kedua-dua bahasa biasanya boleh memahami satu sama lain.
mt: There are various estimates of the number of people who can speak Hindi. It is estimated as the second or fourth most widely spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not closely related dialects are counted. The estimated number is 340 million to 500 million speakers, and 800 million people can understand this language. Hindi and Urdu are the same in terms of vocabulary, but differ in script; in everyday conversation, speakers of both languages usually can understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Hangeul merupakan satu-satunya abjad sengaja dicipta dalam penggunaan harian. Abjad tersebut dicipta pada tahun 1444 sewaktu pemerintahan Raja Sejong (1418 - 1450). Raja Sejong ialah raja keempat dari Dinasti Joseon dan merupakan salah seorang yang paling dihormati. Pada asalnya beliau menggelar abjad Hanguel sebagai Hunmin Jeongeum, yang bermaksud “bunyi yang betul untuk pendidikan orang”.
mt: Hangeul is the only alphabet ever created for everyday use. The alphabet was created in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 - 1450). King Sejong was the fourth ruler of the Joseon dynasty and is one of the most respected. Originally he called the alphabet Hangeul as Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "correct sounds for the instruction of the people".
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Terdapat pelbagai teori akan kewujudan bahasa Sanskrit. Salah satunya ialah tentang migrasi orang Aryan daripada barat India yang membawa bersama-sama bahasa mereka. Sanskrit ialah bahasa kuno yang setanding dengan bahasa Latin yang dituturkan di Eropah. Buku terawal yang diketahui di dunia telah ditulis dalam bahasa Sanskrit. Selepas penyusunan teks Upanishad, kewujudan bahasa Sanskrit semakin pudar disebabkan hierarki. Sanskrit merupakan bahasa yang sangat kompleks dan kaya dan telah berfungsi sebagai sumber untuk banyak bahasa India moden, sama seperti bahasa Latin menjadi sumber bahasa Eropah misalnya bahasa Perancis dan Sepanyol.
mt: There are various theories about the existence of the Sanskrit language. One of them is about the migration of the Aryans from western India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language that is on par with Latin which is spoken in Europe. The oldest book known in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the sorting of Upanishad texts, the existence of the Sanskrit language became less due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language and has served as a source for many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the source of European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Bagaimanakah graviti Io menarik saya? Jika anda berdiri di permukaan Io, berat anda lebih rendah daripada berat anda di Bumi. Seseorang yang beratnya 200 paun (90kg) di Bumi akan mempunyai berat 36 paun (16kg) di Io. Oleh itu, daya tarikan graviti ke atas anda adalah kurang.
mt: How does Io's gravity pull me? If you stand on the surface of Io, your weight is less than your weight on Earth. Someone who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So, the gravitational pull on you is less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Permukaan Bulan diperbuat daripada batu dan debu. Lapisan luar Bulan disebut kerak bumi. Krusta mempunyai ketebalan 70 km pada sisi dekat dan 100 km pada sisi jauh. Ia adalah lebih nipis di bawah maria dan tebal di bawah tanah tinggi. Mungkin terdapat lebih banyak mare pada bahagian yang berdekatan kerana keraknya lebih nipis. Ia menjadi lebih mudah bagi lava untuk naik ke permukaan.
mt: The Moon's surface is made of rock and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust has a thickness of 70 km on the near side and 100 km on the far side. It is thinner under maria and thicker under highlands. There may be more mare on the near side because its crust is thinner. It is easier for lava to rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Ramai orang bermimpi hari bila manusia boleh pergi ke bintang yang lain dan menjelajah dunia lain, setengah orang tertanya-tanya apa yang ada di luar sana setengah percaya ada makhluk asing atau kehidupan lain boleh hidup di tumbuhan lain. Tetapi, jika ini berlaku mungkin ia tidak akan berlaku untuk jangka masa yang lama. Bintang-bintang tersebar luas sehingga terdapat beberapa trilion batu antara bintang yang “berjiran”. Mungkin suatu hari nanti cucu anda akan berada di dunia asing dan tertanya-tanya berkenaan nenek moyang kuno mereka.
mt: Many people dream of the day when humans can go to other stars and explore other worlds, half wonder what is out there, half believe that there are other beings or other life can live on other plants. But if this happens it may not happen for a long time. Stars are spread out so far that there are several trillion miles between neighboring stars. Maybe someday your grandchildren will be in a foreign world and wonder about their ancient ancestors.
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Matahari tiada kerak seperti bumi yang mana anda boleh berdiri. Seluruh Matahari terbuat daripada gas, api dan plasma. Gas menipis bila kita terus bergerak lebih jauh dari bahagian tengah Matahari. Bahagian luar yang kita lihat semasa kita melihat Matahari dipanggil fotosfera, yang bermaksud “bola cahaya”.
mt: The sun has no crust like the earth where you can stand. The whole sun is made of gas, fire and plasma. Gas thins as we move further away from the sun's center. The outer part that we see when we look at the sun is called the photosphere, which means "sphere of light".
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Lebih kurang tiga ribu tahun kemudian, pada 1610, ahli astronomi Itali, Galileo Galilei telah menggunakan teleskop untuk memerhati bahawa planet Zuhrah mempunyai fasa, sama seperti bulan. Fasa-fasa berlaku kerana hanya bahagian Venus(atau bulan) yang menghadap ke matahari akan terang. Fasa-fasa Venus menyokong terori Copernicus yang menyatakan panet-planet mengelilingi matahari. Kemudian, beberapa tahun selepas ini pada tahun 1639, seorang ahli astronomi Inggeris bernama Jeremiah Horrocks telah memerhati pergerakan planet Zuhrah.
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that the planet Venus had phases, like the moon. Phases occur because only the part of Venus (or the moon) facing the sun will be bright. The phases of Venus supported the Copernican theory that planets orbit the sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed the motion of the planet Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Sungai Amazon merupakan sungai kedua terpanjang dan terbesar di Bumi. Ia menakung lebih dari 8 kali ganda air berbanding sungai kedua terbesar. Amazon juga merupakan sungai yang paling luas di Bumi, iaitu selebar enam batu. Sepenuh 20 peratus daripada air yang melimpah daripada sungai-sungai di planet ini ke lautan-launtan datang daripada Amzon. Sungai Amazon utama adalah 6,387 km (3,980 batu). Ia mengumpul air daripada beribu sungai kecil.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and largest river in the world. It carries more than eight times the water of the second largest river. The Amazon is also the widest river in the world, being six miles wide. One-fifth of all the fresh water that flows into the world's oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of small rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Lapan belas peratus dari rakyat Venezuela menganggur, dan kebanyakan dari mereka yang mempunyai kerja bekerja di ekonomi yang tidak formal. Dua pertiga golongan pekerja di Venezuela bekerja dalam sektor perkhidmatan, hampir satu perempat bekerja dalam sektor industri dan satu perlima dalam sektor agrikultur. Industri penting untuk rakyat Venezuela ialah minyak, di mana negara ini ialah pengeksport bersih, walaupun hanya satu peratus yang bekerja dalam industri minyak.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of them work in the informal economy. Two-thirds of the working class in Venezuela work in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in the industrial sector and one-fifth in the agricultural sector. The most important industry for the people of Venezuela is oil, where the country is a net exporter, although only one percent work in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Bintang mengeluarkan cahaya dan haba disebabkan tenaga yang dihasilkan apabila atom hidrogen bercantum (atau bergabung) dengan satu sama lain untuk membentuk unsur yang lebih berat. Saintis berusah untuk mencipta reaktor yang boleh menjana tenaga dengan cara yang sama. Namun ini ialah masalah yang amat sukar untuk diselesaikan dan akan mengambil masa bertahun-tahun sebelum kita lihat reaktor pelakuran berguna dibina.
mt: Stars emit light and heat because of the energy produced when hydrogen atoms fuse (or combine) together to form a heavier element. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can generate energy in the same way. However, this is a very difficult problem to solve and it will take years before we see a fusion reactor built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Unsur dan sebatian boleh bergerak antara dua keadaan dan tidak berubah. Nitrogen yang wujud dalam bentuk gas mempunyai ciri-ciri yang sama seperti cecair nitrogen. Cecairnya adalah lebih tumpat tetapi molekul-molekulnya masih sama. Air adalah satu lagi contoh.Air sebartian terdiri daripada dua atom hidrogen dan satu atom oksigen. Ia mempunyai struktur molekul serupa sama ada gas, cecair, atau pepejal. Walaupun keadaan fizikal mungkin berubah namun keadaan kimianya mungkin kekal sama.
mt: Substances and compounds can move between two states and not change. Nitrogen that exists in the form of a gas has the same characteristics as liquid nitrogen. Its density is greater but its molecules are still the same. Water is another example. Water is a compound made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has a molecular structure similar whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although the physical state may change, its chemical state may remain the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Semasa Perang Revolusi, tiga belas negeri itu awalnya membentuk kerajaan pusat yang lemah - dengan Kongres sebagai satu-satu komponennya - di bawah Artikel Gabungan. Kongres tidak berkuasa untuk mengenakan cukai dan, oleh sebab tiada ada eksekutif kehakiman nasional, ia bergantung pada kuasa negeri, yang selalunya tidak bekerjasama, untuk menguatkuaskan semua akta-aktanya. Ia juga tidak mempunyai hak untuk menolak undang-undang cukai dan tarif antara negeri. Artikel ini meminta kebenaran sepakat dari semua daerah sebelum mereka boleh meminda dan daerah mengambil kerajaan pusat sebagaikan ringan kerana wakil mereka kerap tidak hadir.
mt: During the Revolution War, the thirteen states originally formed a weak central government - with Congress as its sole component - under the Articles of Confederation. Congress had no power to levy taxes and, because there was no national executive branch, it relied on the states, which often did not cooperate, to enforce all of its acts. It also had no power to reject state tax and tariff laws. The Articles required the consent of all states before they could amend and the central government was as light as its representatives often failed to attend.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: Jika anda telah pernah menonton filem 'National Treasure', anda mungkin terfikir satu peta harta karun tertulis di belakang Deklarasi Kemerdekaan. Walaubagaimanapun, hal tersebut tidak benar. Walaupun ada sesuatu yang tertulis di belakang dokumen itu, ia bukan peta harta karun. Tertulis di belakang Deklarasi Pengisytiharan Kemerdekaan “Pengisytiharan Kemerdekaan Asal bertarikh 4hb Julai 1776”. Teks berkenaan tertera di bawah dokumen, terbalik. Sementara tidak ada yang tahu dengan pastinya siapa yang menulisnya, ia diketahui yang pada awal kehidupannya, tampalan dokumen yang besar ini (ia berukuran 29¾ inci kali 24½ inci) digulung untuk disimpan. Jadi, ia adalah berkemungkinan bahawa notasi ditambah hanya sebagai label.
mt: If you have ever seen the movie "National Treasure", you may have thought that a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, this is not true. Although something is written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence "Original Declaration of Independence dated July 4, 1776". The text is written below the document, upside down. While no one knows for sure who wrote it, it is known that at the beginning of its life, this large document (it is 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up to be stored. So, it is possible that the annotation was added only as a label.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Pada awal kemerdekaan, pakar Taman Botani Singapura membantu mengubah pulau itu sebagai Garden City tropika. Pada tahun 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, bunga anggerik kacukan, dipilih sebagai bunga kebangsaan negara ini.
mt: At the time of independence, experts from the Singapore Botanic Gardens helped transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, a hybrid orchid, was chosen as the national flower of this country.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Walaupun pembinaan piramid terus menggunakan batu sehingga ke akhir kerajaan lama, piramid Giza tidak pernah melebihi saiz dan kecemerlangan teknikal pembinaan mereka Kerajaan baru Mesir yang kuno mengkagumi tugu pendahulu mereka, yang berumur lebih satu ribu tahun.
mt: Although pyramid construction continued to use stone until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never larger or more technically accomplished than their Old Kingdom predecessors, the New Kingdom Egyptians marveled at the monuments of their predecessors, which were over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Setiap tahun sekitar bulan Oktober hampir 1.5 juta herbivor melakukan perjalanan ke dataran selatan, menyeberangi Sungai Mara, dari bukit-bukit utara demi hujan. Dan kemudian kembali ke utara dari barat, sekali lagi menyeberangi sungai Mara selepas hujan berhenti sekitar bulan April. Kawasan Serengeti terdiri daripada Taman Negara Serengeti, Kawasan Pemeliharaan Ngorongoro dan Hutan Simpan Maswa di Tanzania dan Hutan Simpan Nasional Maasai Mara di Kenya.
mt: 1.5 million herbivores make the journey south to the Serengeti plains every October, crossing the Mara River from the northern hills to the rain. And then back to the north from the west, once again crossing the Mara River after the rain stops around April. The Serengeti area consists of Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Masai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Dengan pertempuran untuk Perancis tamat, Jerman mula bersedia untuk menyerang pulau di Britain. Jerman menamakan kod serangan itu sebagai “Operasi Singa Laut”. Kebanyakan senjata dan bekalan yang berat Tentera British telah hilang apabila ia dipindahkan dari Dunkirk, yang menjadikan tentera agak lemah. Tetapi Tentera Laut Diraja jauh lebih kuat daripada Tentera Laut Jerman (“Kriegsmarine”) dan dapat menghancurkan mana-mana armada pencerobohan yang dihantar melintasi Selat Inggeris. Walau bagaimanapun, banyak kapal Tentera Laut Diraja berhampiran laluan pencerobohan sebagai laksamana yang takut akan ditenggelamkan oleh serangan udara Jerman.
mt: With the fighting for France over, Germany begins to prepare to invade the island of Britain. Germany names the invasion code as “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army’s heavy weapons and supplies were lost when they were evacuated from Dunkirk, making the army quite weak. However, the Royal Navy is much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and can destroy any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, many Royal Navy ships are near the invasion route as the admiral is afraid they will be sunk by German air attacks.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: Mari bermula dengan penjelasan berkaitan pelan Itali. Itali merupakan “adik lelaki” Jerman dan Jepun. Ia mempunyai tentera yang lemah dan tentera laut yang lebih lemah, walaupun mereka baru sahaja bina empat buah kapal baharu sebelum permulaan perang. Matlamat utama Itali tertumpu pada negara-negara Afrika. Untuk menawan negara-negara tersebut, mereka perlu memiliki tempat pengerahan askar, supaya askar dapat berlayar menyeberangi Laut Mediterranean dan menyerang Afrika. Untuk itu, mereka terpaksa mengusir pangkalan dan kapal Britain di Mesir. Selain tindakan tersebut, kapal perang Itali tidak sepatutnya melakukan yang lain. Sekarang bagi Jepun. Jepun ialah negara kepulauan, sama seperti Britain.
mt: Let's start with the Italian plan. Italy is the "younger brother" of Germany and Japan. It has a weak army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships before the war began. Italy's main goal was focused on African countries. In order to conquer these countries, they needed a staging area, so that troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and attack Africa. In order to do this, they had to expel Britain's base and ships from Egypt. In addition to this action, Italian warships should not do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan is an island nation, just like Britain.
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."
